lVKGXWjS59wyYPOJ_95r8w.text: Love love love this place!  I always order a flat water served on a wine glass, the lyonnaise salad with the Lardons extra crispy, and the hamburger with extra crispy duck fries.  My husband always gets the modules frites which are delicious! Can not wait to try their brunch!  Had to change review unfortunately the last 3 times we have gone each time it has been a different chef and the food is terrible.

ac_ycFHVDI7Wa73WmBJZ1w.text: Fantastic burgers! Duck fat fries  were BOMB!!! A great experience all around honestly!

4feoMxPcHLgD-yMVUkIuiQ.text: I am struggling a bit in giving Andre's a solid score, I wish they allow half stars. So based on the average score I'm giving them on customer service and food I've come to 3 stars. Here's why....  Customer service 2 stars out of 5. We got there around lunch time, so noonish. It wasn't busy yet, and in plain sight you can see there were plenty of runners and servers. We got seated and immediately greeted by a lovely lady offering us water.  Then our server came, Nick. He seemed loopy. And when I mean loopy, loopy that he was babbling and asking us what time it was "what time is it, is it 3:30?" And my husband and I looked at each other like "it barely noon." What the heck? Then he proceeded to tell us we should have come at 3:30 cause they have daily happy hour and the pricing was way better. I admit they were, but we were already there, it just made us seem like he didn't want us.We ordered beignets for starters, lobster roll, burger and the souffle. The food took forever to come out.  I mean 20 minutes for 3 pieces Of beignets. Not sure if our server had put that order in as appetizer or what. I was also very peeved that they didn't clear our dirty and empty dishes and cups right away. The servers and runners were just hanging out at the bar and chit chatting, and passing our table. But never picked it up to clear our table. Mind you we sat on a two top table so all these extra empty plates and dirty dishes easily overtook our table. After introducing himself to us and getting our order we have not seen our server again. The last time was when we were wrapping up lunch, and asked us if there was anything else we needed. I said "more ice please." (I'm 9 months pregnant and there was no air in the restaurant and I was so hot). My extra ice cup never came. . Not sure why there was a lack of service, but something definitely to work on.   Food review 4/5! There is no denying the food is amazing. Although the food did take some time to get to the table, it did come out hot and fresh. The food was amazing! Beignet was the amount of sweetness and savory. Omg the burger (very messy eat) had this umami and balance of savory, sweet, and tart which I inhaled. The fries.... duck fat cooked fries... enough said. For dessert the souffle was delicious. Granted could get it better elsewhere, but still did not disappointed and perfect end of the meal. Keep cooking good food like this, I will come back.

1GtTumEMUGWQSNmaWwo5Cw.text: After reading positive comments from a local food critic, I decided to go and visit the new bistro. The host was very accommodating, polite, super courteous an overall great guy. We are a party of 4, we ordered 2 escargot appetizer and was surprised to find them very salty, we told our waiter and he quickly returned the escargots to the kitchen, after a few minutes he brought them back and we noticed that the escargot sauce was white sauce instead of garlic butter, the chef has added cream to the dish to tone down the excessive salt, it's was awful and also the dish was cold, the manager returned the escargot to the kitchen to reheat, he personally brought back the dish and was very apologetic, we all tasted the escargot and by now I could have used it to patch a hole in my car tire. The fries where also cold and that was exchanged, they of course removed the escargot charges from our bill. Overall, the place is nice, maybe that was a bad day as they just opened and are used to the tourist versus local crowed, I'll give them another couple month and then retry again.. We are foodies, we don't have the luxury of being recognized as some local food critics that get great tasting food.

CyMcz8RDIy_Ot3eDpSsD1g.text: I rarely find myself saying 5 stars, because everyone and everything can always be better. But when it comes to a restaurant experience, if the service , food, price all balance each other, I am bowled! Their regular drip coffee was great. I had the egg white omelette which was so flavorful with the sausage and veggies. Their daily special was crispy waffle with duck and foiegras. Simply delectable. The walnut chocolate gateau and pot de creme were a great finish.

4fJ24B-cdJzmyxPT0rg8kw.text: Andre's is being talked about in local publications as well as it should. At its price point its pound for pound in the top 10 restaurants in Las Vegas.   My meal started with a cheese plate and seared foie gras. This foie gras was easily the best I've had in my life. It lit up my mouth in places I didn't know I had. We had a beet and caesar salad respectively, the beets at this place are amazing, I don't normally like beets but they're amazing here.   Finally the entree, I had the golden trout and my partner the filet mignon. Everything was sincerely perfect and the waiting staff was on point. Exactly the right amount of service without being patronizing.   The desert was out of this world, the pastry chef is up to any bistro in France's standard. I'd come here again. Everyday if I could.   10/10, thank you Andre's!

GdRpC99QOgnXhhMGSUpL2A.text: Quality French Food!  If you like chicken, the coq au vin is very tasty and I would highly recommend it. This spot has great service, and a nice little bar area inside.

-VKbbsqnDyZo2SoR5wNuwA.text: We came here for my birthday brunch while we were in Vegas. It wasn't my first choice, because my first choice wasn't taking any more reservations. Not wanting to wait an hour for brunch, I searched yelp frantically and came across this place. The reviews looked promising and our group was mainly looking forward to eating chicken & waffles (which Andre's has) so we decided to check it out. The restaurant itself is very welcoming and cute. I really loved the decor from the ceilings to the floor, it was very cute and sleek. Our service was also great the entire visit. My reason for giving them 3 stars is for the food we received. 3/4 of my group ordered chicken & waffles. Although it didn't taste bad at all, the breading was falling off of the chicken and the waffles were completely falling apart. It just didn't hold together, which made it incredibly hard to eat. My bloody mary was also just so-so, and the beignets were tried were good but basically just completely hollow on the inside. For the price of the food and the vibe it looks like the restaurant is trying to give off, I just expected the food to be of better quality. Again, nothing was bad, but it just didn't impress any of us.

5z-TNOdXIUuDdnU7geTT5w.text: A friend recommended and brought me to this place, even tho I'm not typically a fan of French food.   Restaurant js a good size in a strip mall. We went about 6:30 on Saturday night and it was not very busy but not slow either. We were seated immediately. Service was fast waiter came right over to take drink orders and bring bread. Bread was very good.   The menu has a good variety of options of French food as well as some salads and "American" sides/ appetizers. Prices were ok a little on the high side but the restaurant looked to be presentable.  I had the Cobb salad and a side of sweet potato fries. Definitely get a large on the salads as the small is in a pretty small extremely shallow bowl and you don't get much salad (despite asking the waiter what the size of the salad was). Other than that salad looked and tasted fresh.   Fries were pretty soggy and portion was pretty small for $6.   The reason for this place getting 2 stars is, before I left I used the bathroom and it was DISGUSTING. Paper on the ground, garbage overflowing, feces in the toilet bowl stuck to the side, some brown contents all over the sink (see pictures) ... this tells me that If a restaurant can't keep a clean  public space such as a bathroom you never know what there kitchen looks like where the public doesn't see. It really turned me off and made me leave in disgust.  Won't be back.

llHURzjGZcHwr-hR405-cw.text: I love French restaurants and French food. Well, OK, I'm French, maybe that's why. So of course I was very excited when I heard Andre's would reopen off the Strip, and wanted to try it. The place is nice and cosy, with kind of a Parisian design and atmosphere.  Food was OK, in a reasonable price range. The snails (yes, I eat snails and I loooove it!) were pretty tasteful, unlike some other places in town. On the other hand, I would strongly suggest they improve their service and staff. This was really disappointing. It took forever to get someone willing to take my order. Then they weren't aware of the prices for the specials of the day. Food took like 30 minutes to come out of the kitchen... Major progress to be done on this.

gmsBehbiDYMvRScOqfcXAA.text: Been here twice, some of the best brunch I've ever had. Every item on the menu is craft-fully prepared and service is great.

M5ntaDaxWDaXsz_Xnpx9pg.text: Yummy yummy and very close to my house. Service was good I like the twist on the hamburgers and my wife loved her fish

The staff is great, attentive and act like they enjoy being there.  Now for the food, I ordered the Trout almonde and it was amazing, brown sugar and lemon? rGSoBHUGIrjCWAo9hLNjjA.text: We were big fans of Andre Rochat's namesake restaurant at the Monte Carlo, so it was bittersweet when we heard of its closing. But the opening of Andre's Bistro & Bar in the far southwest corner of the valley is much more than a consolation prize - it's pure Parisian bistro fare in a contemporary setting, with neighborhood prices. It blew our minds how inexpensive the entire brunch menu was, with nearly everything under $20 and most entrees in the $10-12 range.  We started with an order of three beignets, served hot and pillowy with a dusting of powdered sugar. With a crusty exterior and an almost crueller-like interior, they were a perfect way to start the meal.  We then moved on to the pastry basket, which included a croissant, chocolate croissant, almond danish, raspberry (?) danish, and something called "Mr. Sunny Side," which was a pastry with custard and apricots arranged to look like an egg.  Choosing a main was a difficult decision (thankfully the prices and location mean we'll be back early and often!) but I went with the smoked sausage, gruyere, and caramelized onion omelet, and it was perfect, all of the elements complimenting one another in one big eggy umami bomb. I did swap out my breakfast potatoes for frites (I mean, it's a bistro) and they were exactly what I was hoping for, crisp and flavorful.  Other entrees ordered at the table included a sausage platter, served with a warm potato salad, and a smoked salmon benedict. I didn't try either of them but my dining companions looked pleased with their orders.  Amid a flurry of great new restaurant openings in the Southwest, Andre's Bistro and Bar is poised to become a neighborhood institution.

9DAtn8KMnSvNCiv0y2Eksg.text: Words cannot describe our dinner tonight. All I can say is that they will do well.  Excellent food and service.  I will post lots of pics for you to enjoy.

I was there last weekend and they happened to have a shift change and so we sat there for 20 minutes trying to flag down wait staff. Their servers are always so very nice but when they get busy they really need to up their servers.

BqfgjDNndNHYvBId2f_M6Q.text: Came here a week after their opening day with our friends who had friends that worked/works here.  Impeccable hospitality?  I would say yes, but then they're missing other things.  They got the clearing your plates and refill your water and asking if you want another glass.  That's about it.  They didn't bring you an empty bowl for your mussel shells if you do order that dish.   They didn't check to see or ask if you're done with your oysters and the escargots...we still had 2 left.  Food is ok, nothing I'm craving for since I ate there.   The other half of our table drank a lot... and ordered a bunch of things which I couldn't eat because of my food allergy.  So for me and my husband...paying $150-200 per couple is quiet a lot especially for ok food and service and off strip.   I rather go to the Rhino and spend that on Rhino platter, grill cheese, and shots.   We'll have to give this place another try for lunch and/or happy hour and that it's been months since they've opened.  It seems to be where this place is gets positive reviews from and mostly friends of the staff who are leaving superb reviews.

D5Svr1ofMBM9SFQ7XKW_rw.text: The ambiance is nice and staff is great!!! Portion size super small and honestly didn't taste great.. BUT the duck fat fries were yummy!

6KiZqJ22K6Iug2U-zUTVFw.text: Went to the latest iteration of the andre's tradition in Las Vegas for a wine tasting of Oregon wines.  The food was the star of the night.  Tuna tartare was first with a celery root panna cotta delightful and delicious. Next, a pumpkin risotto with a lamb brochette and sage yogurt sauce. The entree was two generous venison chops with a butternut squash puree.  The sauce was fantastic but the chips were a touch too rare.  The shaved Brussel sprouts were fabulous. Dessert was roasted pineapple with cheesecake ice cream.   Overall, a wonderful night of good food and fine wine in a comfortable private dining room.

54XlXP3carBa9gB3cHJSvA.text: We decided to give this place a try for my friends sending off before deployment brunch. The decor is nice and simple and they have a spacious covered patio. We opted to sit outside since it was a nice breezy day. At first the waitress seemed standoffish but after some time she warmed up to us.   We ordered beignets as appetizers and they were heavenly! Light and fluffy just how they should be made. They have two all you can drink options 1) is mimosas for 24 pp and 2) is the henny sangria for 25 pp. I thought if I paid 25 I could get either or for a nice little mix but I was sadly mistaken. Although the difference is only a dollar, you cannot mix between the two even if you opt to pay the more expensive option. Maybe they should include that as a choice for those looking to experience both.  Now I know you are reading this thinking wow, why only 3 stars everything seems great so far. Well, it's because of my main course. I ordered the Steak Frites and while presentation was to die for the steak was BEYOND bland! Not even the garlic butter on top could make up for it. Having a steak look so marvelous and be so tasteless is really an enigma. Fries were nice and crunchy but could not save this dish.   My friend ordered a lobster roll and enjoyed his food very much. Other friend had the chicken and waffles which he states wasn't very special.  I really wanted to like this place and have a new brunch spot but it looks like I will continue my search!

ZFt6G27mcI5neFKRBjwcqA.text: The food was good, and so was the service. The escargots were nice, and went well with the baguette bread. The seafood tower was not very impressive. It came with 2 pcs each of: fanny bay oysters, shrimp, king crab, snow crab, and a half of a lobster tail. It was good, but looked a little empty.. would be nicer on a smaller bowl presentation or added shrimp as a filler. However, for the affordability of the prices, I cannot complain. I loved the foi gras appetizer and opted to enjoy it with the wagyu steak. They went very well together. The lobster roll was delicious. Simple yet flavorful and filling. We ended the meal with the creme brulee and they surprised me with a complimentary berry plate with a sparkler and happy birthday written on a white chocolate square. It was very nice, and greatly appreciated. The service was attentive, but not overly intrusive. Which is what I love! Can't wait to come back and try different dishes

SigQpmk_grW9M4Z6ke-Pcw.text: This is our favorite neighborhood spot.  They really have carved out the perfect definition of what I think of when I want some place nice, yet comfortable for a meal and wine that is a short drive from my house. The service is on point; we visit about 1-2 times a month or so and everyone is so friendly.  Everything on the menu is amazing and the wine selection is nice.  Their happy hour is a great deal, with a nice variety of discounted items from all over the menu included and $2 off wine by the glass. Plus their happy hour runs 7 days a week.  Some of our favorite things on the menu include the lyonnaise salad with the duck confit, the seafood platter, lamb burger, coq au vin, seared foie gras.  They have added more tvs, which is nice because we were able to watch the rest of the Golden Knights game the other evening.

2FtYsGGrdN6Hr1J7pScPpQ.text: My very first time eating at the restaurant at food was awesome. I had the lobster roll and beignets, which were awesome. However the frittata, and the house made punch was also delightful. The restaurant has a French American cuisine that is truly great.

oNtc5RQq-PQ2fBymYwhVOA.text: I was highly impressed with this establishment!  For those of you who frequent this area of Las Vegas, this building used to be DW Bistro. Good news is that DW Bistro moved down the street and even better news is this awesome restaurant is now in business.  First off, customer service was amazing. From the host to the server to our busser -- everyone was exceptionally kind and came around often to ask us how we were doing.  I ordered the lobster roll and HOLY MOLY, it was love at first bite. The lobster was seasoned just right and the roll was the right amount of buttery. And the fries that came along with the lobster roll were on point also.   Will definitely be back to try more items on the menu. Spoiler alert: this place is a tad bit on the pricier side, but it's totally worth it.

lhggzLPFdNlRgF3oH8IKBw.text: Fourth time in a row that we drive here to try it and they are again closed for whatever reason.  Today, it's a private event that started at 3 PM....we looked at their Yelp and Facebook before leaving home to make sure they were open.....got here....closed, they put it on their Facebook page 10' past 3pm. I drove 30' to get here.....never coming back again.

Y-kDBsRSpKpqULK7sfBXgw.text: When your biggest issue is lighting for your food pictures, you know you have found a good spot.   Met my ladies for our semi-monthly lunch date. On first impression, I liked the aesthetic changes they made as this space was formerly DW Bistro. (Not that DW wasn't also adorable.) Glasses of sparkling rose were clinked, and we took on the world from our table in the cozy back corner of the main dining room.   My friends both enjoyed lobster rolls (they looked good but a bit overdressed for my taste.) I ordered the Thai chicken burger - and folks - it was so clucking good!!  The ground chicken was delightfully seasoned and served on a PRETZEL BUN (Yass!!) with a delicious aioli and sauteed peppers. Duck fat fries were an option but I went with their lightly dressed mixed greens instead. It's been 24 hours and I'm still thinking about this burger, it's that good.   When it was time to order dessert, one of my friends placed her order for the lemon tart, and our charming waiter asked if we would all be sharing it--and we laughed and laughed. Two lemon tarts and a chocolate walnut gateau later and we were 3 very happy ladies.   The lightly bruleed lemon wedge was a citrusy flavor explosion, and the tart itself was to die for. I tasted the gateau and it was also heaven on a plate.  We might not have been able to solve all of society's problems during this lunch date, but I'm sure we will give it a go again in the future, and I'm already planning a trip back with my husband for dinner. Whoever said money can't buy happiness has clearly never eaten here.

wYDco6Iv6THp0pv-EbuabA.text: One of the worst brunch spots ive been too in Vegas. I dont even know where to start: the drink service was quick but pricey, the food service was slow and the food wasn't all that great when it did arrive. It's breakfast for goodness sake!!!! I honestly felt cheated for my time and money. I'll stick to Paris Baguette Cafe or DW Bistro which are both about 5 minutes east of here.   Our party of 14 were sectioned off so we couldn't gauge how busy the other side was, but it took over an hour for the food to come out and when it did it came out it came in spurts. A few people got their food and by the time they finished the other people got theres. It was a disjointed mess. At some points people from the party had to find the server and ask what was going on. She kept saying the same thing -"its coming out". We werent in a rush but at a certain point theres only so much you can drink and you start to notice how long youve been waiting. I thought about cancelling my order and cutting my losses.   The food arrived ONE HOUR and 15 MINUTES after ordering. During this wait no apologies, no visit from the manager, no comp pastry baskets. Nothing.  Just wait, wait and wait so more, pay and leave. No hospitality. No one even ordered a well done steak. Just eggs, a burger and a few salads. I was so disappointed when my food arrived. For one, I told the server specifically how I wanted the fried egg cooked and it came out over easy! I told her to cook it hard. The food came back made correctly in under 5 minutes. I was surprised because the entire order took over an hour! The Croque Madame was a sad dish to have waited over an hour for. I've had better at walk up cafes made in 10 minutes. This one was just a burnt piece of toast topped with a thin slice of ham, swiss cheese and bechamel sauce and a egg on top. Its typically a sandwhich with two pieces of bread and stuffed with ham and cascading with bechamel sauce, but these guys are apparently cutting costs. The top looked burnt, dried out and as if it's been sitting in the expo window for the better part of 30 minutes. The duck fat fries are NOTHING to write home about. Ive had better fries at McD's.   Also the bottomless mimosas are more than most entrees on the menu at a staggering $24.99. I'm not sure when the trend started to charge locals so much for cheap champagne bought at whole sale prices mixed with ready made orange juice. Not even fresh squeezed or even with a garnish on the glass.   While the server was nice i don't think she cared because she was getting an automatic gratuity. We all finished in 30 minutes and there we started the wait again as she scrambled to organize the checks. She had over an hour to get those ready.  Thankfully, i paid cash. Like I said I won't be back and I won't be sending any of my friends there or my guests.

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sad little Croque Madame.

iRhJ4eCYAXZLzWSIyxO3Xw.text: This is in the old DW Bistro spot. I like the vibe when you first walk In. Our server was very attentive he was great. We ordered the following  ricotta gnocchi- we thought it was going to be in a red sauce but surprisingly it was gnocchi with lots of veggies much lighter than what you would expect. And we couldn't taste the ricotta.   Chicken sandwich- my husband said was weak, tasteless.  We asked for a side of truffle Mayo, there is something up with the truffle here I'm guessing the chef uses truffle salt?! It was salty!!!!   Pea Barley soup with truffle- the truffle smelled great but it was SOOOOO SALTY ! We sent it back.  French onion soup - that was yummy  Grand Marnier Creme Brulee- this was the BEST Part of the meal.  I may come back and try the weekend brunch but lunch was not what I expected. The menu items sounded better than they tasted

CuZxL-PcOnEgL_eW1VzguQ.text: It was good but not great to where I would drive out of my way to dine there again. Maybe happy hour when the prices are cut in half.   I came here twice in three days-- once for dinner the second for brunch. I'll start with dinner.   My boyfriend says I'm in too much of a rush, but I just felt like service was sooooo slow. I'm all for having a nice sit-down meal but I think the first impression should be that you're getting the ball rolling as soon as the guests sit down. I had the salmon which was cooked perfectly with a side of mashed potatoes. The potatoes left little to be desired and were disappointing. My boyfriend had a filet cooked medium, but it came out medium well+. It was also really thin. When I think of a filet I think of a small but thick cut-- this one was simply flat. For dessert we ordered the apple tart which was underwhelming. We expected more of a crust which is usually the star, but there was hardly any which made us both pick at the apples and leave it alone.   On to brunch. My latte took a while to come out, and a left it unfinished which I can honestly say I've never done to a cup of coffee/espresso before. There was hardly any foam or steamed milk. The chicken & waffles were weird. The waffle is a cornmeal waffle (not expressed in the menu or else I wouldn't have ordered it) and it comes loaded with gravy. It was good, but not what you think of when ordering this particular dish. My boyfriend's eggs Benedict was so tiny. I'm not looking for American super-sized portions, but everything comes out meek and disappointing. Our dirty plates sat in front of us for a while before they were cleared.   The salmon was so good, and there were so many other desserts that sounded fantastic, that I think I need to give this place another chance before I decided whether or not this is going to be a regular place I visit.

_DzrZK-EiWHSOcXVJvF6fg.text: Let me start by saying I do like Andres and will be back for dinner. Sharrie had the Madame and it was quite tasty. She asked for the yoke to be hard and even sending it back never happened. The potatoes were greasy and under seasoned.  I had the Andre burger with an egg on it. Again                           it was under seasoned but quite tasty. Service seemed confused and not the most personable. Lots of personnel but no one asked if we been there before or offer any interaction except for the basic service. With all that said I still want to try dinner there, in hopes that is where they excel.

r2Dct5w-0u3RVbfPRS90pg.text: We were checking this place out to try something new this weekend. While I believe this place is typically better than 2 stars, I can't give it above 2.   -My lobster roll was quite tasty, but the star of the show was the way above average roll. The lobster was well seasoned but didn't taste fresh. Part of my side salad was wilted.   -My boyfriend got the creamsicle, and to me it was hands down the best thing on the table.   -My water glass on the table had a lipstick stain. No one noticed.   -The hostess literally dropped the wine list on the table... like the leaning tower of Pisa fell and crashed into the bread plate, extra flatware, and knocked the salt shaker over. And she just froze then bolted away! And we though "good evening" from her at 1 p.m. was weird.   - The croque madame was solid, and the best food item.   -The waiter was friendly, prompt, and on his "A" game.   -The single espresso is one of the best I've had at a restaurant on or off the strip.   -The ginger beer was above average.  -The bartender just stood around texting.   -The old-fashioned was by far the worst one that I have ever had. I've had some bad ones. Some that have tasted like a bottle of bitters; others that were shaken. Dear goodness, this was an all new low. Plus, I was never asked, which bourbon or whiskey I wanted. It was like drinking Kool-aid and Maker's Mark. So sweet that I took 2 sips and got a headache. Completely undrinkable.   I want to like this place. I used to eat at Andre's in the Monte Carlo. It was a well-deserved Michelin one star restaurant. This was like the disappointing distant relative to the original. Maybe it was because it was brunch, but I don't want to go for dinner with all of the service and cocktail issues.

P8CKYlb-0vViw0jpYwkpCQ.text: Absolutely great flavor and presentation. Nathaniel was our server and he was very attentive and helpful. Fruit is fresh as well as the sauteed spinach was amazing. Our group had a view different item ranging from duck to mussels to steak and eggs. Everyone was satisfied. PLUS they have bottomless drinks (select menu) till 3pm . I've came for brunch multiple times and it was awesome each time

LEn75PzRVGi6duwFpBb8AA.text: Solid 4.5 since 5 is reserved for above and beyond...  Pros:  - Lobster was delic.!  Peeps burgers and steak dishes were killed.  - Great portion for the price and good selection for lunch!  - Customer Service...as a team, they worked great together.  They even offer 10% discount on the next lunch visit with a receipt.  Cons:  - Customer Service...mixed up included green salad vs fries, but was quickly addressed and the fries was included at no charge.  Missed my lemons with my water and a bit slow on others refills.  They're new, just need more time to floss out the minor kinks.  - Fries was kind of salty...maybe it was just me having a low sodium preference.  - We were placed in the back of the restaurant when there was only two other parties there.  No biggie...just odd, but it worked out cause we were kind of laughing too much.  Stars:  - Luis G. provided great service!

_VeVWPKrcPqzpSKpox-Huw.text: For the price of the food I was expecting a spectacular meal. Froie Gras was extremely disappointing and looked as if a 10 year old put the dish together $28. Gnocchi was okay but I wasn't wowed. Gnocchi was in one corner, peas in one and cheese on another. Service was good I just wish the food was properly executed. A glass of Sauternes, a glass of Rose Champagne and 2 course meal plus tip $90. Hopefully Andre's will step it up their food game.

0v8KoIGoFskH_zNXOoEUWQ.text: Finally! A French bistro that's near home, where I can grab escargot and risotto without breaking the bank or sucking the life out of my gas tank. The ambiance is classy, the food is amazing, and the service is excellent.  We had the escargot, beet salad, and vegetable turrine for starters. All delicious, all well seasoned. With the Complimentary fresh baguette, the escargot fish was left white and shiny.  Lobster roll and iron steak were amazing. I'd definitely come here again and again...And again!

TqtNZD8aK5f0JBFoCr9G8A.text: Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous.  You guys know how to serve a varied French inspired menu, with local favorites, at an exceptional price point for the service and quality.  We enjoyed our meal immensely, from our Escargot and melt in your mouth Foie Gras. To the Wagyu to finish.  We appreciate the boxed service too as we just ate lunch the next day!  Special mention to our friend Nathaniel who kept us entertained throughout service.  See you again soon for happy hour!

xafn05eXviQXbIcz4ZVVdg.text: Only came here for Happy Hour however I am looking to come here for both Brunch/Lunch (if I can wake up early enough) and Dinner.  We ordered:  Afternoon Joe - basically a bourbon spiked coffee that was strong as hell.  Frog Legs Provencal - first time eating frog legs...everyone always said it tastes like chicken but to me its more like gator...a mix of chicken and fish...not the biggest fan of frog legs but the sauce was excellent with the bread  Andre's Burger - for the price of $7 you get an amazing good quality burger with fries...a bigger steal then the piggies that tried to steal jewelry from the Bellagio.  French Onion Soup - Not the best but it sure was one of the cleanest broth for a French Onion Soup I had...if that makes sense...  Lamb Burger - didn't try it..not a fan of lamb however my girl that ordered it said it was juicy but didn't quite like the taste...  Overall they have a very solid menu regardless of the time of day and with established quality to the name and for the price point you know that you are getting a excellent meal at an affordable price.

Tex9is2zY_6jAje6weX_zw.text: Excellent food. However the service is extremely slow.  2 to 21/2 hours for appetizer,entree and desert.  A little too leisurely for me.  Appetizers are enormous you should share. Entrees are not.  I will be back.

3U0WOA4B-Vb_CUMFUMg5sw.text: Underwhelmed by the service and food. Very disappointed that while they provide crayons for children to color with there is no kids menu. We were charged $22.00 for a chicken breast for my 6 year old. Definitely will not be returning.

OJv3YMT5eir5mPzSI4CtVw.text: Went for dinner, the beet salad was so delicious we had to order two! It is a must try! Can't wait to try brunch.

fbv8ghd9W2SwLUAgm6u-tg.text: One of the best lunches i have ever had..that i felt compelled to write a review here. My younger sister and I decided to stop by Andre for lunch today, even though the establishment looked rather empty..we decided to still give it a try based on the yelp reviews and i must say...i agree with every single positive review here. I ordered a thai chicken burger, and my sister opted for the steak with herb butter and duck fat fries..and everything was AMAZING! We also decided to share a souffle, which I have decided I won't be sharing the next time..keeping one for myself! I will definitely be back here again, and again

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak with duck fat fries

pD88kO8BV4wc9D11z1MirQ.text: Went to happy hour with my parents and we really enjoyed everything we had. We started with frog legs and escargot, then moved onto the charcuterie and the cheese boards.  The foie gras mouse was sublime The onion soup was delicious as well as the burgers.

_DHvcoBILcFZpSxdftoERQ.text: Staff-rude. Especially hostesses Who point out your mistakes on open table when you arrive and even turn the computer around to make sure you understand your mistake.  Appetizers-excellent. Caesar salad with real anchovies and the seafood platter but both outstanding.   Beverages-great. Excellent cocktails and  interesting and reasonably priced wine list.  Entrees-disappointing. The burger and the salmon we're both a little overcooked. The muscles had sat too long under the heat lamp. The muscles were replaced but this time the sauce was like warm water.  We did enjoy our experience here. The appetizers and cocktails made it worthwhile, I just wish the staff were a little more professional. After spending over $225 it would be nice if someone could wish you a good night when you leave! Is there no manager on duty?

JJ1cr_dEu2_TjAL24uL60g.text: This is a new place that just opened near or home. After work one day my boyfriend and I decided to stop by for dinner on a whim. Nice ambience. A bit too quiet for my liking. Ordered the burger with upgraded duck fat garlic fries and the mussels with French fries. Food was good. Service was good. The have frog legs and escargot on the menu, If that's your thing.

XsTYE-PBq1-6PlUeGK3Qog.text: Went in for brunch on a Saturday afternoon after hearing great things about this place and was left very disappointed. The food was decent but service was horrible.   We were a group of five and wanted to start with some beignets which we ordered the same time as our oysters, sad to say that the beignets never came. The French Onion Soup was nice and flavorful unlike most of the rest of our meal. The lobster roll was bland and nothing on it popped or stood out as far as flavors. The quiche Loraine was cold, soggy and mucus like. I also ordered a side of the potato salad which when I asked the waiter was explained as a potato dish with eggs mixed with mayonnaise and mustard. When it actually came out it was the same as the breakfast potato dish that someone from our table received, sauteed finger potatoes with onions. I pointed out to the busser and waiter that this was not what I ordered and they then continued to convince me that what I got was actually their potato salad. I didn't want to send the food back or argue with them so I decided to give it a try and was unpleased with how much they lacked salt, but had an overpowering taste of black pepper. When we asked to get some of the food to go one of the ladies that worked there gave us attitude since we had to ask her to wrap it up again after she had left the dish on the table for 20 min after cleaning the table off before the desserts arrived. The desserts on the other hand were amazing. As a group we ordered the milk shake, creme brulee, the sundae and pot de creme. Mmmmm.... all of them were beautifully executed. I probably enjoyed the pudding dish the most. It was like a chocolate truffle pudding. I wouldn't mind giving the place another try but I hope I don't get the same staff.

R8W-eiULC_c_QQMhKNLbdw.text: Andre's Bistro has finally hit its stride.  The food has always been good - we've been three times, but the service in the past was poor.  This last visit on Friday was outstanding.  The food was delicious and our server could not have been better (thanks Nathaniel!), along with the other help.  I attribute this to the review in the LVRJ newspaper that mentioned the poor service.  What a turnaround!    As for the food, we had lunch - French onion soup (excellent), a chicken sandwich and a burger, with, of course, duck fat fries.  The chicken sandwich was declared to be delicious and my burger was one of the best I've had.  Perfectly cooked with great condiments.  The bread and butter are both wonderful.    Overall, we can highly recommend Andre's Bistro.

cFGOk96UZ5-Fr2lU7XwFIw.text: Lobster roll is great!  The service was bad.  It took over 30 minutes to get our food.

3Cw9A2q7FqD5mQhzRagCgw.text: This place is phenomenal!!! We came here two nights in a row and I can't wait till I get to go back. From the impeccable service to the food... they hit the nail on the head. We had the seafood platter,escargot, frog legs, oysters, to the filet to the Andre burger and mussels, the Creme brulee. I died a little inside with every dish that came out! Delicious food. Great ambiance. Every table sitting beside me was also having the same experience as me! You could hear everyone saying how amazing every dish was. How amazing the service was. My new favorite spot! I almost want to keep it a secret because I want to keep this amazing place as my hidden gem!

5eSb6Uv2A7pxofCAbc0ANw.text: Absolutely one of the best trendy restaurants in vegas....food is amazing...atmosphere is relaxing and service was fantastic...definitely going back

wZ7S9mlCcmKtw_eIYhImYw.text: I have been a fan of Andre Rochet since I moved to Las Vegas in 1991. My wife Sandy and I have frequented Andre's Bistro and Bar four times since their opening week and have found the food to be consistently wonderful and the service to be expert and cordial. We will return again and again as it is a bargain to boot.

N4yXtH3uAItO8QFZkSW6bA.text: A classic in the making! Absolutely wonderful! Was lucky enough the sample a little bit of everything on the menu and it was very impressive. Great service and hospitality.

u4sR7bTJksN9xu_RJp3hTQ.text: first time to this restaurant.  went during happy hour.  many restaurants restrict happy hour to the bar only, but not them which i like.  had  escargot for 7! they were great, esp the garlic sauce which was absorbed nicely with their bread.  had discounted coq au vin which tasted great.  friend had a nice piece of salmon. he must eat gluten free and they accommodated him nicely.  they even had gluten free rolls which he said were some of the best he's ever had.  service was great.  discounts on all drinks for happy hour.  we will be back!

GGmucj4v7LL8npxq-2r20w.text: I researched the best burger in LV and Andre's came up.  After driving about 25 minutes from the Strip I landed at Andre's.  I was blown away by the food. I didn't even order the burger (which comes with caramelized onion and a red marmalade jam, cheese and bacon) but instead ordered the Lyonnaise salad with Lardons (think thick cuts of porky belly) and a poached egg with warm sherry vinaigrette.  After one bite I was in heaven.  It was an EXPLOSION of favors on my pallet.  Did I forget to mention that I added duck confit to the salad?  It was amazing,  absolutely incredible.  Get there early on a Friday afternoon for happy hour and wonderful service provided by Bailey (the waitress with attentive service and a warm smile).    The chef is French;  he  knows French cooking--from French onion soup to chocolate souffles.  This  ain't his first rodeo ya'll.  He's got a restaurant on "The Strip"  too.  Give this place a try.  You won't regret it.

O7uKZkFkuiC-gup_yUfcXQ.text: If I could give this place a minus star, I would. You should be ashamed of yourself by calling this place, a French restaurant. I have been to Paris, France and  let me tell you, the French food there is excellent as well as the service. I ordered the Golden Trout Amandine, and it looks really yucky to look at. I took a bite of the trout and it tasted like salmon. I sent the food back, it was so horrible. There for dinner all I had to eat was bread and butter, because I ordered the steak, and I had to send that back too. Such horrible food. At a least a free dessert would have been nice to rectify the situation, and to warrant a second chance to try this restaurant again. I paid $12 for the tiny Andre's Classic Souffle, it was good but not worth the price. I hope this restaurant closes soon. Chef Andre you created an epic failure.You failed to convince me to return to your restaurant, and a simple I'm sorry from the waitress does not do anything to rectify my anger and disappointment.

Bl_e0QCXRI98Y8XMoksFGA.text: Thank you Yelp for helping us find Andre's- there is no smoking which is a huge plus! Good was excellent- beet salad and Cobb salad (large servings) were delicious. I added salmon to the beet salad and it was delicious! Creme brulee was smooth as silk! We sat at the bar and Tim was so Knowledgeable- ask him anything about menu!! He also makes a great cocktail!! We will be back this week for sure!

0YPWxJw6r6_Vt8_Yk6EhOg.text: Andres is such an awesome addition to the Southwest. Strip quality food at about half the price and no attitude (or paying to park!!). The calamari was delicious and my salmon entree was great. Perfect choice to have an upscale experience without all the hassles of leaving my neighborhood and heading to the Blvd.

17UKSKUOjhH1f-WAsyjxLQ.text: Can't recommend. Souffle was probably the worst I've ever had. Took two bites and done. I did enjoy the daily special of coq au vin. The other dishes in my group not so much...

veHVGHquqJThH5XmL1T67g.text: Had a great dinner and our server Nick was perfect! His recommendation for a half chocolate/half Grand Marnier souffle was VERY much appreciated, so delish! Couldn't ask for a better time and I will definitely be back to try the brunch.

rJUErwWGIJ__Hj6icLdMBg.text: Poor and inattentive service!! Went for Sunday brunch and informed the waiter it was my first time there. First, he didn't even mention kids menu options when I ordered a full priced entree that I said was for my kids. He also seemed aloof and not mentally present in the sense he would walk around and totally walk right by me when I was trying to get his attention. The food was overpriced and mediocre. Ex. 22 bucks for some oveecooked mussels and fries. Shame.

suxNIhTJ0QGgsnfV0tGq8g.text: The food was really good! My wife had the clams and I had the lamb burger, both of which were delicious! We'll definitely be back!

2DoJGwME7Hugzv9ajNeMUA.text: Great spot for brunch. My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place a couple of months ago when they first opened. We loved the atmosphere inside. Everything is very modern and fresh. Their cocktails are on point, I remember being very pleasantly surprised. The portions are perfect too. I hate when I go out for breakfast and the portions are huge! I always take it home but then never end up eating it. But these were perfect and very delicious. We have to try it for dinner at some point but I highly recommend brunch.

pbv8g_CFEKtsR_HLIcBHPw.text: I'm really loving this place! Our waiter Michael was amazing and informative and very nice! I ordered the roasted chicken and it was absolutely delicious! It was very moist and flavorful. Our table also ordered the oysters and they were so fresh and delicious! Everything we ordered was awesome! This will b our new favorite spot! Highly recommend.. go!!

JFt6MUaZ2k26iFccg4En1A.text: had lunch today w friends coq au vin and gigondas for wine i eat all around las vegas and this is probably one of the best value i have encountered so far... check their lunch, happy hour and diner menu... good for both low budget or more i will be back soon w friends very impressed... andre is the type of chef who cant retire because he loves his craft..... he owns alizee at the palm tower, one of the best restaurant in las vegas.... no wonder....

lzbcVkWeIt1GGS0wmTwwLg.text: Go eat, enjoy, laugh, weep at the beauty of every dish, swoon over the complexity of every bite. Get the mussels, feast on the duck sausage, melt with the creme brulee. Treat yourself to this divine experience, the price is reasonable, the value is extraordinary

yOSYOzx3wxTmp_5sRlwQkw.text: I took my 6 year-old daughter to this restaurant last night.  We had seared foie gras, bouillabaisse and kid's mac n cheese.  Seared foie gras was delicious.  Portion was big.  Bouillabaisse was very tasty.  The fish and shrimp were slightly over cooked but the broth was incredible.  Tons of seafood.  I also loved the ambiance.  Very bistro-like.  Service was excellent.  I would recommend for girl friends night out or causal date night.   A bit too quiet for kids or big family.

fRUhw1Djfq0CeaXJje4o8w.text: Thank you Chef Rochat !  You have hit it out of the park.  I have been enjoying Andre's since the early 90's downtown.  My wife and I have visited both locations at the Monte Carlo and Palms several times since they opened.  The menu is great and new.  They also have the classic menu with the pricing very reasonable.  We had the charcuterie platter and crispy calamari as an appetizer, I had the risotto which was cooked perfectly with just the right amount of tooth resistance, perfect flavoring and a larger than expected portion. My friend had the lobster roll and she was extremely happy with that. I will definitely be back at Andres Bistro and Bar.

n77NaZhOmtFIYyoumUE0oA.text: Been here twice, still not feeling it. I appreciate the finer approach to the neighborhood bistro, but the arrogance can be left out. The food was extremely heavy, rich more like it... duck fat galore. Unknowledgeable when it came to the cheese and charcuterie boards, seafood platter wasn't explained when dropped either, rather annoying. Bummer, I was hoping to enjoy this place.

Eg8NkyRyFah7K8NJau-ybQ.text: The Andre's burger is the best burger that I've tasted in quite some time! It came with duck fat fries! Delicious! Great and fast service, decent beer and wine list. I highly recommend this place and I will be returning.

nU8VHbp3n1wzm_QY-EeZnQ.text: Went last Saturday for a spur of the moment brunch.  The service was very good, you could tell he came from fine dining. Bloody Mary was not my favorite, and over priced in a small glass, I would prefer a better recipe.  We had the Vegetable Quiche - awesome  - light fluffy  very good!  and the Brioche French Toast, also a hit!  We were first in as they opened so everyone was on point. The server offered the Beignets as a complimentary sample from the chef - they were super!  I will be calling to order a dozen for pick up!  It is not two $$  three for sure, but worth it.    I would go back!

YfTzGjqWMrSkX4M1ndyU8Q.text: If you like French bistros and great food you need to go here. You will not be disappointed. Excellent onion soup. Great tasting beet salad. Lamb shanks perfectly cooked.  Flatiron steak is correctly prepared  and is cooked to order. I recommend the lemon tart for dessert. Excellent service. One of the best meals I have had in quite a while.

ZMhrZGY7EBGQLndSCQbodA.text: Not sure I could have been more underwhelmed by the experience at Andre's Bistro and Bar. The only thing positive I can say is there was a warm greeting when we walked in and our busser was attentive when it came to refilling our water.   That being said, the overall service was bummer. Our waiter took our order, ran over to tell us that if we wanted the souffle we had to put the order in RIGHT AWAY, and that was the last time we saw him.   Our cheese plate came out on a fly by with no explanation of what was on it. I had to flag someone down to ask what some of the accompaniments were. Then our entrees with the same drop off.   The ribeye I ordered looked a lot more like the "flat iron" they had on the menu and was cooked all the way through. (Ordered medium rare)... I've seen better steaks on IHOP commercials. My wife's ricotta gnocchi came out surrounded by a messy plate of inedible bitter greens and a mint "paste."   If you're thinking "why didn't you send it back" I didn't see anyone again until our water glasses were empty and wasn't going to just sit there until someone noticed us.   I did wind up flagging down our busser again, this time to pay, after we sat there for another 10 minutes after finishing our meal.   Maybe it was an off night as I have heard good things about Andre's but if so, it was a James Harden level off night.

JvGV8gykyZvP7M6vaM6lfg.text: Great burgers today.  A great place to visit.  Service was amazing and Andre's burgers were yummy!.  Shawn was right there to offer suggestions on the menu.  The Manager Nikki gave a little history on the place dating back to the Rat Pack days.  We had fun and will definitely return with our friends soon..

un5-v_5vnifLE1YrM0VA-g.text: Decided to check Andre's out since we heard and read good things about the place. We like the casual feel of the room and we're greeted in a friendly manner.   Started out with a Calamari appetizer which was very good, though a relatively small portion. That doesn't very much concern us...if you want big portions go to Claim Jumpers.   There then seemed to be a delay and while waiting for our entrees we noticed that no one in the restaurant was being served...kinda weird, but ultimately our plates arrived. The Artisanal Housemade Sausages were very good and they brought mustard and pickles on the side.   Moules Frites consisted of very meaty mussels in a delicious sauce but 1) there were no tomatoes in the tomato concasse...we pointed it out and they brought them out from the kitchen, 2) the duck fat fries that came with were room temperature, 3) they provided no small fork for easier access to the mussels 4) they provided no plate or bowl for the mussel shells.   Andre's is not overly expensive but neither is it cheap so I expected a little more. But we'll certainly give them another shot since the food quality is high.

8uU_xKepwuZ-Ssj7B5oJAw.text: Came here for a friends Birthday and am so happy I got to discover this gem! Staff are so lovely, food is amazing and the atmosphere was perfect. Love this place and was recommended by another guest to come back for their brunch. I definitely will :)

KShNG4b-r9rB_WAgQY4TKw.text: I haven't found very many places in Las Vegas with great French food--but this place is superb. It's a trendy / classy atmosphere and would definitely recommend as worth a try.

y2TCcAPw329_Bk_rhKBQQg.text: Can't go wrong with anything on the menu, I've only been here for brunch and lunch, haven't had the chance to try the dinner menu but I can't complain about anything! Service is awesome, the food is amazing and the ambiance is great!!!

rwE_jbacIBgoWELD4THTKQ.text: Andre's has been a part of this city for so many years, having this location so close to where we live is a treat. Great staff, amazing food, in the True spirit of what Andre's has always been about. Exceeded our expectations tonight.

ahS7kjDXQepZZ2bK75ZkmA.text: The first time I came here, it was ironically last year during restaurant week. I remember that they did not know about it initially until they asked someone in the kitchen and then brought the menus out. They were not well organized but they made up for it with good food. They were new at current location. That is why I gave them five stars at that time. Tonight, I was let down. To begin with, there were five people in my party and I specifically put on my open table reservation that it is for a birthday and the name of the person. I even called the restaurant personally one hour before and they confirmed that they had the information that this was for someone's birthday.  We get there on time and we are sat at a regular table. We are given regular menus. I see that the waiter is holding smaller menus, which did turn out to be restaurant week menus, but he did not give us those until I asked for them. This is the second year, during restaurant week, where they did not offer the restaurant week menu. Then, to make things worse, our waiter is absolutely clueless! First he tells us that he believes that a filet mignon is on the restaurant week menu that can replace the flat iron steak and then he tells me that there is a dorade type of fish on the menu. Neither is right. We order our food and the food is pretty good. We get to dessert, and nothing! No candle (not important), no decoration (not important), no happy birthday (important). Her dessert was as plain as ours.  Several times we had to signal the waiter to come over to fill water glasses as they were empty for quite a while. I also had to signal someone for the check. What's crazy is that the restaurant was not full... In fact it was less than half full! The food at this restaurant is delicious, but the service has a great deal left to be desired. I hope a manager reads this and takes this seriously because I have come to this restaurant over eight times in the last year and usually the service is OK or below par, and it has never been outstanding. I chose to come here instead of going to an incredible restaurant on the strip for convenience because we only live five minutes from this restaurant. I was really let down tonight and my friend's birthday was non existent! This restaurant needs to be careful because it may have great food but it needs to keep up good service. Once again, really let down tonight.

r-9cZVxO_lhlLzJ3MP1n4A.text: Nice brunch good coffee and also good service but I hope they're have more choices in the menu soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pn90gW5IBsBhWmZz9kNOcw.text: This restaurant has a good customer service, but the food is overpriced!! It is good quality food but not for the price!

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

780M5Sm6rIslJJJfsQpVzw.text: Service was phenomenal, everyone from the hostess, the bartender, Dani/Danny the server, the bussers, and anyone else who helped us were so incredibly nice and genuine.   I really liked the small atmosphere.. It's got two rooms but the one that was attached to the bar area was awesome.. It had good every ave everyone was having a great time. Plus it was close to the kitchen so food came out quickly!!   The drinks were good!! Their happy hour is 3-6pm I believe, and it's $2 off drinks!! I had the lamb shank with orzo pasta, served in a savory broth. My friend had the bouillabaisse which was cooked very well and had a great presentation!!   The frog legs were okay.. But maybe I just had very high expectations since it was my first time!!

LjuTJ_7FS4pYZS4bS7rKXQ.text: Delicious food. This is my second time here in a week. I had the lobster roll the first time and the EBLT. Both were phenomenal.

SZA8fyzfgA9yjsVsHVbHcQ.text: Wonderful first experience! We celebrated our wedding anniversary here for dinner tonight, after cancelling plans to go to another restaurant further away from the house, and I'm so glad we ended up here instead! And many compliments to the chef!!!

kdz372KhOA8RmC90eWrHBg.text: This is a wonderful little bistro! I was in the area for business and enjoyed my first meal so much that I went back for a second time.  The Thai chicken burger and duck fat french fries were wonderful and the Grand Marnier souffle was fantastic! They have a creative and generous happy hour menu. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in the Vegas area.

yIw9E8b0AXhJPfC9J6HMOA.text: There have been very limited changes to the decor since Andre's took over the space formerly housing the DW Bistro.  My wife and I started off sharing a Lyonnaise salad that was impressively large and delicious.  Our entrees were less successful with my wife ordering the Scottish salmon and I the moules frites.  The salmon was topped with some roasted bell peppers and included a mundane cauliflower sauce.  My mussels, though farm raised in PEI, had not been cooked long enough leaving several unopened and others on the raw side.  I forgot that our Groupon included 2 glasses of Champagne until I began to settle our bill so we gave those to an adjoining table.

ds0O9lt19h25hlrsdc960g.text: Had date night here last night, wasn't super disappointed but also not really impressed. Our server Nate was really attentive but also allowed us to enjoy our meal without bombarding our table every 5 minutes. We sat further back in the restaurant which was nice because it was still light outside and there are a lot of windows in the front - being tucked back there was a darker and more intimate.  Started off with the charcuterie plate. And a couple glasses of the Sonoma Chard. I'm not joking the meat + cheese portion was soooo small. One roll of prosciutto, and two slices of the thinnest coppa I've ever seen, there was a nice amount of the duck pate (my personal fav) so that was nice. Cheese - blue cheese, taleggio (so yum but just not enough), and the other two were firmer cheeses' and clearly not memorable. There were more toppings (d. mustard, cornichons) then there was meat + cheese. So there's that.  For entrees we both choose the Cobb (salads aren't my usual choice but it was super hot outside and I wanted greens) comes with grilled chicken. I expected it to be warm and sliced chicken. But it was cold and in chunks, which makes me question its freshness. My bf subbed the chicken for steak, cooked to a perfect med-rare temp. Surprisingly the up-charge for the steak was only $6 (about 4oz filet)   I do really like the bar area. I'd return for drinks and different apps with girlfriends. But def pass on dinner next time.

wlEwARZEpcID0Ly6Sk21eQ.text: A mainstay on the strip for over a decade at the Monte Carlo and now, hopefully, they'll be a mainstay in the southwest suburbs with their newly opened, more casual French bistro that took over the old DW Bistro space. The layout is pretty much unchanged, but the addition of dark wood accents and some modern lighting really make this space more intimate.   While there are some traditional French dishes on the menu, the food is anything but old and stuffy. The sauteed foie gras is a modern dish paired with nutella brioche and strawberries to create an unforgettable combination of savory and sweet. For a more traditional dish, the braised lamb shank was a flawless execution of tender, fall off the bone meat over orzo pasta bathing in a rich, tomato based sauce. Their risotto is outstanding -- great firm texture to the rice, covered in a savory sauce and parmesan. I loved the flavors, presentation, and execution. The charcuterie board was an excellent display of house cured meats large enough to share with a few friends.  Less impressive were the gnocchi dish and mussels. The former was full of summer vegetables and ate more like a salad. The latter entree had some huge mussels that were too chewy and gritty.  Don't forget to ask about their specials. The first night I dined there they featured a lobster thermidor. While expensive, it was a beautiful display of buttery crustacean.   I can never turn down dessert, and with a souffle on the menu I had to get it. They had both a grand marnier and a chocolate version. If you can't decide, like me, get the half and half. A light, fluffy souffle that showcased both flavors well. Another dessert, the dense, sweet chocolate gateau, was fantastic. Even though it was a relatively small slice it packed plenty of punch.  This is, without a doubt, a special place that's perfect for a date night or group gathering. Let's hope locals will fall in love with it and keep it around for years to come.  4.5 Stars

nycXE1ivjaQCECMjYTZuOw.text: Did someone say, brunch?  Who doesn't love Rose' all day on Saturday and Sunday's.(Well maybe from open until 3ish)    They did a nice job renovating the former DW Bistro while still maintaining some of the charm. We love sitting at the bar when Tim's working, as he is so attentive and personable. The bar stools feel like a "pillowy-cushion" and you can charge your phone if you have a USB cord! Awesome when your phone is always on the dead side!  If a burger is your poison, this is the place to chow down on one. The bun paired with sauteed onions and butter lettuce melts in your mouth. If a salad is your thing, stop at the cobb.  The winner here for appetizer's is the escargot. The garlicky, herbal mixture was nothing short of amazing.  You'll want to order extra French bread to sop up the extra sauce because they give you plenty.    The downside is, they took the croissants off the menu for whatever reason known to man.  We hope they have an epiphany and put them back on.  Bon' Apetit, my sweets.

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffles are pretty and delicious!

WGUxRiauvCpDcTAEYupgDw.text: I loved this spot! Not in the location I would expect for such a delightful brunch. Yogurt/Fruit parfaits should never be too incredible because come on, no carbs. But it was so delicious and beautifully presented. Eggs benny was top notch and the potatoes had a hint of crunch with the fluffiest softness inside. And well, bottomless mimosas... need I say more?

NelUtBE2q2KJ5GwCPrSnKw.text: First time here, I ordered food to go because my wife was in the hospital and we did not want their food.  Even though the food looked good and everyone was very nice, the problem with food to go is if they over cook your food as in this case, a burger ordered medium rare comes out medium well, it makes the $14 I paid for this burger a waste of $14 dollars.  The fries it came with were good and the garlic mashed was really good.  The only bad part of this meal was the over cooked $14 burger which got thrown away because it tasted horrible.  Will we try this place again, maybe but not for to go food.  Very sad...

cpZJHlRi0vyYRfgSZjDdKw.text: I love this place.  French bistro with traditional French food without the French price tag.  I love their appetizer list and every entree has been beyond good!  Love the ambiance and the bar.  Staff is always friendly and welcoming.  I even got a text the other day from the owner informing me of an event.  It's one of my favorite places to eat!

vOyuYVO1aSjFF9w0BmVj4g.text: Went for happy hour here because we randomly saw it on Yelp. Decided to try it out for the great $8 burger deals they had but were majorly impressed! The inside is a very nice casual and modern, great for a date too! Slightly dim lights and nice glassware and table set up. We got both the Andre's burger and the lamb burger. Both were seriously amazing! And for $8, the size was big and it even came with duck fat fries (which are a step up from normal fries)! I subbed my fries for a lobster Mac n' cheese which cost $6 more to sub it instead of fries. Super worth it! The size of the Mac n' cheese was twice the size I expected, it was an entire good sized boat of macaroni and you can really taste the lobster, they put more lobster than I expected in it! Try the grapefruit beer too, that was a delicious drink. I think we found our new burger spot! Will be back for sure! And Nate was our server and he was very knowledgeable about the food and he suggested more recommendations than I asked for! Great server! Also, sorry for the phone quality, I had to snapshot the photos from a video I took. You can see how big the lobster Mac n' cheese is and the sizes of the burgers!

KeeqFlU-cyZ_6_gvkoyPMg.text: My husband and I came here for happy hour on a Friday as I've heard great reviews and rants and raves about this place from family and fellow locals.   We ordered the escargot, Andre's burger, charcuterie board, salad with balsamic vinaigrette. Everything was fantastic. Will definitely be back for the escargot- which was my favorite. Their escargot is THE BEST IN TOWN! I've tried escargot from a few high end restaurants at the strip but Andre's serves the best!

7CeYv25E3lso8dsSi2izEw.text: My go to spot in the neighborhood!   I first came for the happy hour, sat the bar, and enjoyed the signature burger which was fantastic, and a real bargain at $7. Tim was the bar keep at the time, his service was excellent and was the reason for my return actually. On my second go I met Cameron who is the other bar keep, and is a True craftsman of cocktails. I shared a few ingredients and he proceeded to make me one of the most balanced cocktails I've had from this request. The service from both of these guys is second to none, and the fact that they turn out some solid drinks is a bonus. If you visit venture out from your typical vodka soda and you should be pleased. The food is excellent, i have not had a bad meal here. If i had to pick my fav's so far i dig that signature burger with that marmalade, and the gnocchi is a solid dish as well. I will state my only small issue and i hope it gets addressed but there has been a lack of consistency. The fries are different on occasion, and I've had different buns on my hamburgers (like wonder buns). If your ironing out the kinks, just know you had it right form the start, don't change a thing.   If you live in the Southwest you are doing it wrong if you're still going to PT's to eat. Come down, give it a try....just save room for me at the bar.

Service is wonderful and  every item I've ordered has been, well.......Devine  From the fresh hot bread served to the table to decadent desserts, it is a winner!  Daily happy hour and lunch specials let everyone have a treat if a meal here, no matter the size of you wallet.    Patio seating available too

4S-Owu3RwJ3Tb0EOsXRSYg.text: Andre's is the place to be to celebrate your birthday with a large group!  They are very attentive to reservations and following up to the moment you walk in- they welcome you with a warm welcome!  It was perfect start to celebrating the evening. I started with a Cheese Cheese and Charcuterie Board Dinner & Pinot Grigio! So amazing, the only wish we had was crackers instead of bread. Then, we moved on to Escargots de Bourgogne for a different pace of taste which was melting into your mouth right when you take your first bite. After, my friends decided to surprise me with the One of Each dessert platter. I blew my candles with Saturday Sundae which was the hardest piece to share since it was so decadent and delicious I didn't want the taste to end!  My server Christian was a great server and as well as the others who helped with my party of 10! Thanks again Andre's! Will for sure be coming back and recommending.

kGu2hPutk5cbMDUriZA-UQ.text: Being a local of this area for many years and frequently dining at the last restaurant here, when Andre's popped up I was interested in checking it out.   My first time here was for happy hour-  Cheese Board-the jam served with it was not great and they did have pickles and mustard but I think it just needed more variety with it-maybe more jams or nuts. The cheese was just ok.   Frog Legs-my husband said he was not a fan  Andre's Burger-I really enjoyed this. I loved the fries too. When I asked for medium, they actually gave me medium. First time that has happened in forever.   Lyonnaise Salad-way too vinegary. I am not a fan of all frisee salad I have found out. It is too boring for me. The lardons were huge which some would appreciate but I felt it overwhelmed the light frisee.   Service was great. My first time here would not exactly bring me back, but I am curious about their main dishes.

OqmA9ooNCsvcc097YNnaGA.text: Great new find. Can't wait to come back. Excellent service, great food and nice ambiance.

elc7G9_nL_huNiBk4RKGxA.text: Such a great environment. Reminds me of a place in Austin. Quite homey feeling and just great vibes.

ypMw7ZJRqQwzNVNF6NFaow.text: We went here for the first time on a Sunday for brunch. I am so glad to see some of these more unique and fun places start making there way to the local areas of town. Having to trek down to the strip for a Brunch is annoying. This was a breath of fresh air.   We were seating in what seemed like overflow seating. It was where they may host catering events, etc. I am mentioning this because there were glass racks everywhere and this is where a kitchen door was. Not the most appetizing area to be seating but I can understand why they do it.   We started with mimosas and bloody Mary's. We did not get the "bottomless" option but they're available for a few of their drinks. We then ordered beignets. They were so yummy! Piping hot too.   We ordered eggs benny, croque madame, and chicken and waffles. They were all delicious! Their fries are fried in fuck fat...need I say more? One issue here; the fried chicken with the waffles was very spicy. There was no mention of this on the menu (that we can recall) and it would have been nice to know in advance. The person eating it is not one who enjoys spicy.   We will be back. Pricing was totally reasonable!

LshddaKPJ5ZmqYBZhWvUaQ.text: Sadly, I have been to Andre's 3 times prior to yesterday. Enjoyed it every time. That was why I chose the location for a special birthday lunch for my best friend. I made reservations several days prior. We arrived right on time and were shown to a very small table for 2 when there were plenty of larger tables available. Women need room to put their purses, instead of settling for the floor! They no longer had a separate lunch menu. It's the same menu for dinner. If I want to pay $100.00 for 2 for lunch (I drank water, my friend had 1 beer), I will go to the Strip. I asked not to rush the second course, but was still eating my first course when the 2nd arrived. We had to ask for their French bread. The server said we didn't want any!!  We never did. No birthday acknowledgement. I won't return.

J-WGghQkGLJBrIpCdnibHg.text: Great food and service. Bit pricey and limited menu choices but, great drink menu and the food choices they have are super good. Have been here multiple times and recommended. One of better bistros in town

MS525o8Z0loZHUpKJBfWTQ.text: Andre's is the hidden gem on the west side!  Great ambiance, great service and there is always something in the menu I can really enjoy.  The Golden Trout Amadine dish is one of the best I've had.  The Seared Foie Gras is to die for!  The Braised Lamb very satisfying and the Bouillabaisse on Friday's is always great.  Best of all, is the Rib Eye Steak, which IMHO is a better deal than Fleming's any day.

qmSua3rnr5-chWpcCVWfUA.text: I had been here once before for brunch and had a good experience. Tonight, I showed up at 6pm with a friend and there were upwards of 15 empty tables. We were told that without a reservation, we wouldn't be able to be seated until at least 8:15. We were flat out turned away. We felt as tho this was on purpose because I was in jeans and sneakers and my friend was in sweats. On yelp they are listed as casual, and there were even young kids seated inside. I won't be going back to this restaurant sadly, their food is pretty good.

paKkWhxzPJKGGJZC5JaAFQ.text: We had a wonderful dinner last week! The sea food is really good and the Andres burger as well the service is impeccable and the atmosphere as well! He had so much fun!

2Vk834pqKx8PMHxxuVHiTw.text: All team is friendly and they make me and my family feel special. The waitress girl is sweetheart and got great hospitality attitude. Food expensive but it's savings my trip to strip for nice food.
