LyUCfzhwH6Y3-weNz8LZyw.text: What a treat. Skip the chain restaurants for lunch. This is FIRST class Bistro. We came here for the first time and can't say enough about how good the lunch was. Large, super delicious sandwiches with homemade potato chips. We also sampled the desert. OMG, the outstanding walnut chocolate tart is so good we can't wait to go back again.  Felt like we were back in France or Italy at a 5 star place. We had to bring part of a sandwich home.  We really are looking forward to trying more of their food and drink. You won't be disappointed.

SNBNfmaPoOtcZi9ZB_b7gQ.text: Excellent food, friendly staff. Location might be better, but the place is friendly, and the food is great. Best kept secret and a great eating place in SW Vegas.

n4W1fMlhPRhxSADsFWJmiA.text: I love this place. It's very quaint and has great food options. I enjoy their brunch menu items on the weekend and although their unlimited mimosas are a bit pricey at $25 (compared to other places) I must say they do NOT cheap out on the champagne which is just how I like it. If you are looking for great french cuisine, this is the place and you will not be disappointed.

buD7ygqLjppb2S5VXR79aA.text: This was our first time here and we did the Restaurant Week lunch.  I had the creamy potato truffle soup to start, followed by the trout almondine with haricot verts and ended with the creme brulee.  The soup was fantastic. Creamy with great texture and truffly without being too truffly. The  trout was perfectly cooked and very moist. The haricot verts were also well cooked with some crunch left in them. The custard of the creme brulee was silky smooth and the berries on top were very fresh. The only thing I would improve was the bruleed top could have been a bit thicker for some added crunch. The staff was very friendly and attentive from the host that greeted us to the bartender waited on us. The assisting staff that delivered our food and bussed our table was also friendly and helpful. We are looking forward to returning for Happy Hour or dinner.

h-dKrfJBkXT9GkN7M8zDIQ.text: Very very good food high priced but worth it ! Deserts not so much , bummer because that's my favorite part ! Xo

GUefovSK1rojL6_2zKsAuQ.text: Without doubt...the best local secret! Quality of service, food and most importantly, fresh produce makes this our go to place.  Brunch, lunch, glass of wine and appetizers, happy hour and dinner.  Andre treats his staff like family and it shows!  100% recommend   Well done Andres Family/staff  We love you!

JBjtEy239VEmVbojGqpBsg.text: Honestly, we had a terrible time at Andre's on Saturday night. It was packed, which is completely expected for a Saturday night, but the restaurant was totally understaffed. It was 20-30 minutes between each contact with our server. We were at our table for 30+ minutes before actually ordering our food and an hour before we got our appetizers.  We ordered the foie gras app and the meat was burnt to a crisp, completely inedible, and couldn't even be cut. The french onion soup was basically salty water. Our entrees were only a little better, definitely needing salt, but it took so long for the server to come over to us that we ended up asking the table next to us to borrow theirs. When we would ask a busser or food runner for something (salt, lemon, more water) they would leave and never come back. Our server was really nice and we actually felt bad for her. It was only her second weekend there and she was totally overwhelmed.   We finished eating and sat there for another 30 minutes, trying to flag SOMEONE down to bring us our check. The server brought the bill and we gave her our card, only to have her come back 10 minutes later to say that the register was having some sort of issue and our card couldn't be ran. She disappeared again before we could get a proper explanation...we didn't bring enough cash, soooo what would they like us to do? Again, we sat for minutes wondering what was going on. We finally flagged down the manager (who never showed up when we originally asked for her) and asked her what the deal was? We had $50 in cash and the bill was $59...could we use our card to pay or not? She didn't apologize, but told us "...to just go."   I guess we got a few dollars off our bill, but what kind of manager responds like that?! I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone and we will never go back. We couldn't decide which was worse, the service or the food. When all was said and done, we were there for two and a half hours and only spent about 30 minutes of that actually eating!! The rest of the time was spent praying for someone to come to our table. The worst!

71qgoxKg7KjdSNXaJS7mZw.text: WOW!  My husband and I were looking for a great French restaurant and we found it at Andre's! Started with the foie gras - 2 orders since my husband doesn't like to share :)... Our servings were generous and perfectly prepared.  Delicate and delicious...I savored every bite. Husband had the French onion soup to start and we shared the artisan sausage plate.  The chef is creating magic in every dish, we look forward to making this restaurant a regular on our list of go-to dining options! Service from Nate and Kenny was spot on, attentive, present when needed and knowledgeable. Thank you for satisfying our French food cravings...we loved every bite!

NCnwD_kdwDuv9g9-K2GYbw.text: This place is awesome. Hidden away in a strip mall, the food, service and atmosphere was great. Moreover, during happy hour, many items are available at a lower price. The burgers are to die for. Basically the food is great, if you don't eat here you are not going to taste great food...

AEnhma7GCSLQfx_0_RWjGA.text: If you are looking for something different in the Valley, why not try afternoon tea at Andre's, Saturday & Sunday's. Starts at 10:30 am, reservations suggested. The food is excellent & the pastries are heavenly. Service is superb as always.

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gH4HddKjjp_QWhrDKfOJdw.text: While the rave reviews continue, I remain underwhelmed by my experience here. The service was a little rough, but they had opened only a few weeks prior. The food was only average.  I tried the escargot which were standard, but the baguette that came to the table before hand was wonderful and very nice to soak up the garlic herb butter with. The onion soup au gratin was unremarkable. The salmon entree was bland and could have used some help from a sprinkling of salt. Duck fat fries weren't anything special, but fries are always good. When asked if a shrimp cocktail was possible since they offer a raw bar, it took several trips back and forth to see if they could do so, but in the end they were able to accommodate the request and i appreciated it. It would be helpful to have a raw bar menu so that you could build a seafood platter by mixing and matching. The vegetable terrine, or pate as it might have been called, was one of my favorite things to arrive at the table.  When we sat down, I had asked about a bottle of champagne and recommendations. Little was known about whether or not they had a blanc de blanc or which tended to be more pinot noir heavy. Again, they had only opened for a few weeks, and so I don't blame them for this. I was however, given two different answers which didn't inspire confidence. We also had someone join the table about 30min after we sat down and it was like pulling teeth to get another glass of water, a glass for the champagne, and an order in. The service was a little slow, but to their credit they were very busy that night which is a great sign for business.  I've seen pictures of their beautiful souffles and that alone might be enough to draw me back!

ithGGsHKYxohGuNRXybkXg.text: Loved the Lobster Thermidor so much we came back the very next week to have it again! It is not on the everyday menu, it is a special, but I guess something they have most of the time. The Escargot is fabulous, and the Crispy Calamari is another appetizer I would highly recommend. The Chilled Seafood Platter was tasty, the oysters were delicious, the lobster, however, was a little tough and not one of my favorite parts of the platter. The Golden Trout Amandine was really really good. The fish was cooked perfectly! It was so light and fluffy and the sauce was a perfect compliment without overwhelming the flavor of the fish. I am so glad that Andre's Bistro & Bar moved into the area. This will definitely be in our regular rotation for dinner.

Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saturday Sundae, is delicious!

ixL8qvbv2GYxZU_Smnhxnw.text: First time here and was impressed. Started with the escargot and French onion soup.  They have gluten free bread as well, was really tasty, like rye bread.  Escargot was done in a garlic butter sauce, and was very good. Onion soup was very good and very hot.  I had the daily special beef Bourgogne with mashed potato while my wife had the trout almandine.  Beef was very tasty and melt in mouth tender. The trout was done perfectly, green beans were crisp and yummy and both out mashed potatoes were good.  For dessert my wife had the lemon tart and loved it, I had the seasonal sorbet and berries.  The sorbet was pineapple and I found it to be too tart for me.  I was expecting sweeter but got a really sour sorbet.  I'm not a sour person, so I didn't really like it.  Berries were good!  Definitely be back.

_EeSq5oXO7mynEBm0X1aAw.text: This is a letter I sent to Andres a couple of weeks ago. After not getting any response (not looking for any handouts just wanted them to fix the problem) and them still not addressing the issue I decide to post it for all to see, as I don't want anyone else to have the same issue we did: "We LOVE Andre's (see our previous review), so it was easy for us to choose your restaurant to celebrate our anniversary. We were so excited for our dinner with you guys. We arrive there at 5pm Sunday so he could take advantage of your Happy Hour..couldn't wait for steak, lobster Mac & Cheese and desserts. So imagine our disappointment when we got there and you CLOSED!!! Neither Yelp or your own website reflect these new hours and changes to Happy Hour. Please update these sites as to not disappoint anyone else. We still love your restaurant but thanks to you our anniversary has been ruined as we were forced to make last minutes changes to our plans"

1gUa1_tXtLD5-eMMZFLarA.text: I was extremely excited about this place. French restaurant off the strip?! REALLY? And seeing escargot on the menu, I was SOLD.  I went here with a group of people, and got to try several dishes.  Escargots- 3.5 stars.  French Onion Soup- 2 stars.  I'm not sure what cheese they used, but I swear it wasn't Guyere. Maybe mozzarella. It was waaaaay too soft. It lacked the slight bitterness that Guyere adds to the dish, so I was disappointed.   Seafood platter- 4 stars. Such a small platter for a great price. It's perfect for 1/2 person. Yes, not for 2 is my point.  My salad with the egg on top sounded great, but I wasn't diggin' it too much, since I didn't finish it.   My friends loved the baguette they served at the beginning, but I personally wasn't a huge fan.   I may be back to try several other dishes. It looks like their brunch is a lot more popular.

j7QuDUzyPzp60YoTVBW8DQ.text: We are an insta fan! It's been a while since I have written a 5 stars review. We came to Andre's for early dinner today. We sat outside on the patio. The restaurant is chic, and tastefully decorated.  The service was really great. The waiter made sure our waters and cocktails/ drinks were filled. We ordered most of the items from the happy hour menu. Happy hour is from 3pm to 5.30pm. The menu is unique which I like. We had the Charcuterie Board, everything on it were really delicious. The escargot was really flavorful with  tons of garlic and butter. We also ordered Frog legs, although the batter was heavy, it was meaty. We ordered Andre's burger to take home. Don't forget to order the house cocktails, it was also delicious. The bill was about $87 and $104 with tips for a happy hour meal but it was worth it.   Overall, the food portion was not small and the quality was excellent and so was the service and experience. We will definitely be back.

UFmPQm9DEnFST4-qCg-L8g.text: I won't cross Andre's off my bookmarks list so that I remember to go back again - and again.  Loved this place!    We were seated right away, given menus and a paper bag with the best bread I've had since moving to Vegas - 12 or 13 years of drought wiped away with a single bite.  Dense bread, with a crisp crust, just the way I love but can't find here.  See?  - it CAN be done!  Fortified with my glass of good German Riesling, despite the "no booze" warning on the medicine bottle, we ordered a Roasted Golden and Red Beet salad to share.  The kitchen divided it for us, plating each one prettily, and it was soooo good.  It didn't specify greens on the menu, but I was thrilled to see them there.  Just the right amount of dressing was paramount, since I forgot to ask for it on the side.  Wonderful combination of flavors.  My husband ordered Andre's Burger, medium, and it was incredible.  The red onion marmalade was perfect and plentiful, two slices of tomato were actually deep red (an accomplishment in this era of tasteless pink tomatoes), and the bun was brioche-y and lightly toasted, crisp where it needed to be, and soft in the right places.  He had them hold the truffle mayo, but that burger wasn't lacking for anything.  The accompanying basket of fries were enough to feed four.  I went for something different:  Trout Amandine, swimming in a beurre noisette, along with green beans.  I would have loved a larger portion of the green beans, but it was a beautiful dish.  I guess I've become accustomed to spicier food, because I thought it was a tad bland, but I think it was exactly the way it was supposed to be, because I finished every morsel of that sucker, something I never do.  And I was grateful that it wasn't salty at all.   Our server, Lori (or Laurie?), was friendly and good, and the manager, Cheryl with a C, bade us a warm goodbye.    I'd love to try their Happy Hour, but having it only from 3:30 to 5:30 makes it unlikely.  So I guess it'll be dinner again next time, and I hope that'll be soon.

GGiFIRfu2V8LvEwLpYnSbw.text: Everytime I visit Las Vegas, I have to make a stop at Andre's Bistro Bar! I've never had a meal that disappointed me. Everything has been sooo delicious! The chef also introduced himself to us and explained everything he made for us!  My favorite is always the Foie Gras!!! I'm so addicted to it!  I've had the fried frog legs for the 1st time at this place. I didn't think I would like it, but I was wrong...I loved it!!

LfI2lYQxjEurlpv3uE7oog.text: Really great French place for date night. Review as follows ~~  Service: 5/5 Our server Nicholas was amazing. Super friendly, knowledgeable about the menu, and gave amazing recommendations for sauces, wine pairings, and dessert! Water cups never reached half empty, and they were super accommodating when I didn't like the cocktail I ordered. I can't over state how amazing the service is here.   Food: 4/5 Roasted Vegetable Terrain: 3.5/5 Personally, not my cup of tea. My boyfriend loved it, but I was pretty indifferent to it. I do like that they use quality ingredients, and the flavors complement the veggies rather than mask the taste. I didn't like the gelatinous texture, and I personally prefer richer foods. Recommend if you want something light and fresh.   Gnocchi with pea puree: 4/5 I thought the gnocchi was a liiil' dense, but I really enjoyed the pea puree and the flavors. Really yummy vegetarian option ~  Ribeye steak with green peppercorn sauce: 4/5 The steak was overcooked. My boyfriend asked for medium rare, and it came out medium well. What really saved the meal for him was the green peppercorn sauce our server recommended. He said it was so good he could've eaten it as a soup. Separately, the steak was a 3/5 and the sauce was a 5/5.   Mashed potatoes: 3.5/5 Mashed potatoes are always good, but they weren't anything special.  Chocolate and Vanilla Souffle: 4/5 When our meal came out, our server gave us a heads up that the souffle takes 20 minutes to make so we ordered before we ate. Five minutes after finishing, the souffle came out. It was fantastically fluffy and rich, with a good rise. Plus, both flavors and sauces were amazing.   Chocolate Pot de Creme with Vanilla Ice Cream: 4.5/5 Basically described to me as "chocolate pudding on steroids." Super rich dark chocolate pudding, topped with whipped cream and a sugar madeline cookie. Definitely recommend getting the vanilla ice cream to balance out the bitterness and the richness of the dark chocolate.    Pricing: 4/5 I thought the prices were super reasonable. For one appetizer, two entrees, one side, two desserts, and two drinks, it came out to $120 before tip. The ingredients are quality, the taste is good, but I think the real steal here is the service.  Overall: 4/5 Overall, I totally recommend this place. Great place if you're craving French food, or you're looking for a cute place for date night ~

8Ba3h3CfhryqCmQrbTSZ6w.text: Great location and Atmosphere. The service is always good... We have been very happy with our meals, but the menu is limited. Mostly tried dinners, but will return to try their brunch.

y9ZEETsncF9yN-elI2AzXw.text: First time at this fun little bistro! One of my very good friends from San Diego was visiting and we decided to do brunch. Well, I knew just the place thanks to Yelp!  Easy to find and close to home. We were greeted warmly and seated promptly when we arrived. The hostess did ask us if we had a reservation and I could see why. The place was almost full and I was glad there was just two of us. Our server Bailey was really what made our experience a 5 Star! She was full of personality and then I found out she hails from Michigan which is where my hubby is from, so we hit it off. She was helpful with our selections. I would love to have her again as my server next time I eat here.  It happened to be National Waffle Day yesterday for those that were unaware, but I just wasn't in the Waffle mood. There were some awesome looking Waffle dishes listed on the menu to try though.  I selected the Quiche Lorraine and my friend decided on the Lobster roll sandwich. Our food arrived timely and everything was really tasty. The Lobster roll did not lack Lobster and we shared both plates so we had a chance to enjoy both entrees. The Quiche was hot and cooked just right with a spicy finish. I had a yummy mimosa and my friend had a pricey glass of Chardonnay which she really enjoyed. We decided to close out the meal with an order of beignets. Oh my! Just so melt in the mouthy were these lil gems! Thank goodness there were only three as we could have ate more.  We sat inside since there was no room outside so I would recommend making a reservation if you really want to sit outside. The great weather heading our way is a good reason to sit outside. The interior is beautifully decorated with a mixture of industrial, modern and old world. It has a very charming feel and the space is not too big. The bar area is small but cozy. I could easily see myself dropping by for a little happy hour.  Honestly, I can't wait to return for dinner!

CZS6ddG0dKhwZ57RGNdhpQ.text: We don't normally celebrate Valentines Day but I've been wanting to try the newly opened Andre's so hubby surprised me by making reservations.   We were seated right away even though we got there 15 minutes early, a plus in my book. The place is minimally decorated which gives off a more sophisticated look. Even though the tables are spaced closer than I would've wanted, it didn't deter my excitement in finally trying this place.   Along with the regular menu, a prix fixe menu was offered for the night. I perused what it had to offer and since I'm not really a big fan of oysters we decided on doing ala carte instead.   We started with the bread. Conscious enough not to fill up on it, and making sure we had room for dessert because after all that was the main reason I wanted to try Andre's lol. We were undecided if appetizers should be ordered but ultimately gave in. Calamari was lightly crisp and served with a sweet Thai Chili sauce. For our entrees Hubby opted for the 10 oz flat iron steak with bearnaise sauce as recommended by our server, with a side of garlic mashed potatoes. Honestly that sauce was not even necessary. That steak was perfection! Tender and flavorful, mouthwatering. I had my eyes set on the Roasted Chicken breast with mushrooms, bacon, pearl onions and fingerling potatoes. Moist with crispy skin, deliciousness in every bite.   Make sure you let your server know ahead of time if you're planning to get souffle for dessert, it takes about 25 minutes to make it. Lemme tell you, it's worth waiting for and worth all the calories! It was lusciously gratifying.   I can't wait to return and try their brunch options. Also looking forward to trying the escargot and maybe the frog legs?!?! Best part is you get all this at a fraction of the strip prices. Delicieux, bon appetit!

OqW_nUKtU7cPr-fxMvoBGg.text: "Go to the people and places that set a spark in your soul."  Andre's Bistro & Bar is the perfect neighborhood French Bistro!  The Monte Carlo lost out when they opted to move on from Andre's, but fortunately for residents on the southwest side of town, Chef Rochart and his team decided to reinvent themselves in a familiar bistro style concept the neighborhood should adore.    Andre's Bistro & Bar doesn't bring with it all the sophistication of their former establishment, but they do bring absolutely incredible food and excellent service. The setting and ambiance are ideal for their new Summerlin hood--elevating what the former DW Bistro had to offer, while bringing along a few remnants from their previous incarnation. I really enjoyed dinning in this space. It has a warm, inviting felling, and there was a great energy throughout the restaurant the evening that we came.  The food doesn't disappoint. My love and I started with the escargot and then shared the Mushroom Risotto and the Lamb Shank, before finishing our meal off with the Grand Marnier Souffle. We were dinning with our best friends and took the opportunity presented to try the Roasted Beet Salad as well. The menu features classic and refined French cuisine as well as a few contemporary items. The wine list nice and features some quality new world wines as well as several French wines.  Andre's Bistro & Bar is nice enough to take a date to, but it is really is an excellent choice for a double date, a small group of friends, or a business lunch.

iGTmNL0_44Q9TGsE_2vVHg.text: Enjoyed Andre's Bistro for the first time today. My husband ordered the Andre's Burger, which was cooked his perfect medium and the duck fat fries were amazing. I had the Lobster Roll with sweet potato fries and honey, which was amazing. We shared an order of Brown Sugar Glazed Bacon, which was good. To wash it all down, I had the blackberry rickey, which I loved. We really like this place and it's close to home so that's a bonus. The people are great and the atmosphere is inviting, we will be back again and again!!

HeHfPw5HNjMxf8mXG0RePQ.text: For quite some time, my gut had been starving for a nearby neighborhood French dinner spot....and now that ludicrously; shallow-assed prayer has been answered!  Andre's move from Monte Carlo to southwest Vegas may be a loss for tourists, but a huge win for locals.    I loved the fasual (fancy/casual) setting as well.    Finding it difficult to commit to any appetizer, since they all looked so damn good, we chose 3 (Sorry, escargot.  Next time!).  The Lyonnaise Salad was a great start.  Busting the poached egg all over the frisee and smoked lardons provided us with our own little private #yolkporn show.  Savoring those final fork stabs of cured pork fat had me yearning for another order as soon we met the face of the plate.    Seared Foie Gras: Baybeee, this is what I came for!  So enamored was I with this dish at the Strip location; this was an absolute must-order.   $10 less and a bit smaller in portion still delivered the mouth orgasm I sought.  The apple strudel accompaniment was new to me and took things up a notch (my belt included).  Not accounting for how fantastic the two complimentary warm baguettes with butter would be, there were concerns about not making the finish line, which was the Grand Marnier souffle that had to pre-ordered, so we split the special of the night.  Their Coq Au Vin was rich and satisfying; filled with chicken, mushrooms, and lardons (yes, more!), it was a wonderful segue to dessert.    I am so down for repeat visits.  Whether it's lunch, weekend brunch, frog legs at happy hour or just a couple of cocktails.  Can't wait!

pf0BcmyKsyGf_dJlnm8Riw.text: Hard to believe there closed already, phone/answering machine makes one believe there open? Drove over to eat after hearing phone message of being OPEN???  THERE CLOSED!!!  POOR MANAGEMENT & TO MUCH OF IT!

LX8KWjWFLhZxtkIbUYh6oA.text: Flavor was lacking for the majority of our dinner. Service was friendly but not very attentive. I think they only had one waiter that evening but it wasn't really that busy either - about 6 tables. Aside from taking our orders they did not check in after the food came out. I was awaiting the bread and butter but it never came until I asked the runner if he wouldn't mind bringing it out still since we didn't get any. They came to collect our plates 15 minutes after we finished. They did have a kids menu but again the flavor was not that great.   We ordered:  Lobster Roll - lobster is shredded more like a lobster salad in a roll  Wagyu steak and mashed potatoes - mashed potatoes were meh, the steak was the best item that evening but nothing out of this world  Kids mac and cheese Kids sliders  I would have liked to try a dessert but just wasn't feeling it after the experience. They gave us a coupon for a free dessert next time w/entree but I don't really see us returning.

Rk9iVc4pxNrNsEjJ9bc_ew.text: Did it through delivery so the quality I'm sure is better in the restaurant but still it was very good. The French onion soup was slightly bland but at the bottom you notice the bigger herbs and the taste comes out wonderfully. The risotto was great with so much mushrooms and you can tell it's made fresh. The price point is slightly high for the amount but I would still return. If they lowered the prices a few dollars I could see myself adding this to our normal rotation of rest  Edit to add.   I have been ordering andres a few times a week through postmates for a while now. The dinner time everything has been spectacular. There new risotto is even better then the old one. But I had a craving for it in the afternoon and it was like a totally different experience. No consistency between the chefs. The soup they put the bread inside for a to go order so it was like eating soggy bread instead of liquid and the risotto was inedible it was so creamy. More then 2 bites was overwhelming it was so much fat and cream. I will still order it at nights but would hope a restaurant as nice as Andres could have some consistency between lunch and dinner staff

vApDisMo6TVO4gGl9BGzBQ.text: Service pretty good, atmosphere was nice and modern. First time we came here the experience was excellent. French onion soup was one of the best i've had in a long time and they had a really good Croque monsieur.  Second time around the soup didn't hold up to my initial expectations, and as well they no longer offered my Croque monsieur sandwich. We had the mussels and fries - the sauce was so bland we asked if they could do something about it. I almost never do this. I felt a little embarrassed to call out the chef- no cook ever wants to be told their food is bland. They did attempt to fix it and give the sauce more flavor and body but it was doomed from the beginning.  Overall decent French food, but a little on the pricey side for the food quality and flavors. 3.5 stars.

AG_uoY39aBYVqR1JVyy1sg.text: I had high expectations for Andre's, especially with many many people telling me how good it was and how it was worth trying. Well little and behold our experience was FUCKING TERRIBLE! I made reservations through OpenTable which was the best part of my experience. It was quick and efficient completely the opposite experience when we arrived at Andre's. I made reservations for 7 plus 1 child at 6:00 PM for Mother's Day dinner. We arrived a few minutes prior to 6:00 and the table was just about ready. We were seated efficiently and this was the best part of our experience.   Upon being seated, I don't even remember our server introducing himself. We sat down without any menus on the table it took probably 10 minutes before menus were brought to the table. We ordered appetizers as we waited for the rest of our party and our server mentioned he'd drop some bread off at the table as we waited. As the remainder of our party arrived, they had to ask for waters and asked for bread since we had been waiting for 15 minutes already. As we ordered our main courses, TWO of the options I wanted weren't available, I WISH our server had mentioned that certain dishes weren't available anymore. IF our server had told us dishes were unavailable FROM THE START our party could've had our eyes set on items that were available. I'M DISAPPOINTED ANDRE'S! I wanted a lobster roll but you ran out, I wanted the lyonnaise salad with duck confit BUT you ran out as well. It's common courtesy to let your guests know upon seating that certain items were not available anymore.   Moving forward, once our appetizers arrived, we noticed bread hadn't been dropped at the table yet and two water glasses hadn't been filled either. We asked once more for bread and water and they said they be right back. So as we waited for the water and bread we dived into our apps. By the time we finished our apps bread hadn't been served yet and water glasses weren't filled. I was trying to stay positive about our experience but I have to admit this was FUCKING TERRIBLE!   Finally receiving bread after 30 minutes and all our apps were finished, the server brought 1 roll to serve 8 people so yet again we had to ask for another roll. We waited another 15 or so minutes for our main course items to come out. As soon as they arrived many more issues arose. All dishes were served EXCEPT the Cobb salad, WHICH admittedly is easier to make than cooking a steak to perfection. ARE YOU FUCKING KIDDING ME?!? Then as one of the steaks were brought out and ORDERED as MEDIUM it was cooked to WELL DONE! And the reason / excuse for the execution was "it was left under the heat lamp too long" YOU'RE KIDDING ME RIGHT?! It's one thing to make up a reason to a guest who doesn't know much about the restaurant industry, but for me the excuse is bullshit. What kind of heat lamps are you using?!   After approaching the manager of the situation, he said he'd comped some desserts but at this point why would we want anything when everything went wrong. I'm livid about this experience. On a special occasioned day like Mother's Day I would like to think that management would have been better prepared for large parties by staffing appropriately. But unfortunately, we were given pitiful excuses and terrible service.

cM2E5iCY9W4xHDEROBuE_Q.text: Very nice restaurant! We took our food to go but if we had the time I would have loved to dine in.  Everything tastes really fresh and full of flavor.

kunSEmsGfRT6CizCJSeCkg.text: I'm only giving 3 stars because of the good service. We had Jose and he was full of jokes and smiles. The chicken and waffles was the most underwhelming I've ever had. Chicken was bland, dry, and not crispy at all. The waffles were limp and only good if drenched in syrup. The omelette was tasty, but super oily. I would not recommend this place and will not be returning.

xybJ6eekuW2H8Tq-yf6Orw.text: Great local spot!  Watched Monday night football here at the bar and couldn't have been happier.  The service was professional and not over the top.  The food was delicious.  I strongly recommend the Charcuterie board with the Pork and Pistachio pate.  The Confit Duck with poached Egg and Frisee was also off the charts.  They told me they are also open for brunch which is definitely going to be on my to-do list for my next visit to Vegas.

5x4Y2KsSf58jb6FMRShGYQ.text: This place was just as awesome as DW Bistro, which used to be at that location. The bottomless house punch was very good and strong! The chicken and waffles was quality, especially the perfectly fried chicken! I love the chill atmosphere her too! Definitely worth checking out!

yB8eTODfSjgLt7DR5sNACA.text: Amazing!! I haven't had anything here that wasn't fantastic! Their Andre's burger is delicious. I've had multiple cocktails here that have all been great. Highly recommend!

XIe19FmLHUa_mRuY5jiVBw.text: We had a large party for a birthday celebration and there was a preset menu. Everything was great until the orders came in and the dishes were ordered wrong. We kept telling the waiter that this was not what we ordered and he argued with us for 10min. Worst service ever. Will never come back!

-VbKkKsL1ajD5yU7_nBfkg.text: The original Andre's was one of Las Vegas's iconic fine dining French restaurants. It's was a pleasure to see that they were able to keep the feel of that dining experience and the wonderful food and apply it to this bistro. The food was still wonderful, the atmosphere was nice and relaxed, and the location makes it easy.

N1AlVPCnIhIV5M6LwjfJMg.text: What a wonderfully delightful gem to find in the southwest part of town. When looking for what another diner called "fasual" or fancy casual French/American fusion dining, look no further than Andre. Celebrity chef and AAA 4 Diamond honored Andre Rochat has taken over the old DW space and opened the newest French restaurant in SW Las Vegas. The ambiance is upscale but casual and very chic. I love everything about this place from the dim pendant lights to the rooster bottles on the shelves to the real silver tea kettles. This place knows how to serve up delicious French fare and you don't have to break the bank enjoying it! We enjoyed the escargot for our starter.  The garlic herb butter was absolutely to die for and is perfect for dipping your crusty and warm baguette. For our entrees we had the Braised Lamb Shank and Orzo and Burger with Truffle mayonnaise.  Both were delicious but the lamb shank was fall of the bone goodness! For Dessert was the delicious Creme Brullee topped with fresh fruit and caramelized sugar. Everything was on point. I have found my favorite new restaurant in town!!

pYmqHVwBVlPtjIvQyf_OUg.text: Review based on lunch and two dinners. You won't be disappointed with the tasty lobster roll for lunch. Nice soft bread and they don't skimp on the lobster.  For dinner had the delicious beet salad and mushroom risotto which was being eyed jealously by my tablemates. It was as good as it looked. Haven't tried anything sub-par at Andrea yet. Hope they stick around.

MG8ln3hkAFkhUmjDqbdxtg.text: Had a fantastic brunch here over the weekend. I ordered the Croque Madam w/ the salad and bottomless Rose.  So delicious! And the baguette they bring is warm and so tasty. Definitely want to come back to try dinner.  Super cute location as well and nice patio.

Rxq91sXvyiG_Tp853j-cRA.text: Dropped in due to the good reviews.  I liked it.  Low key, friendly, neighborhood place.  Nothing fancy, just a cool place to drop by with friends and family.   It's a Bistro, so the portions are smaller, and you order a la carte.  I had the fillet and then added a green peppercorn sauce.  I also had the green beans with almonds.  I thought the green beans were better than the fillet.  The fillet was small - 6 oz, but I didn't really want any more than that.  I had it medium rare, but I would have preferred a little more sear on the outside.  It had a piece of gristle, or silver skin running through, but it was still good.  I also had the Caesar salad, which over dressed, but the flavor was good.  So why the 4 stars?  The service was really good, and the vibe was friendly.  If I lived in the area I would go there all the time.  Andre's has a good bar set up, so dropping in and sitting at the bar would be an option.  The beer selection is not very big, but well thought out.  I'm not sure I would make the trip from the strip (which I did), but like I said, if I lived in the area, I would be there all the time.

L2DE2sJ3sNAoKAsye3ZsXA.text: We went to Andre's today for brunch, and were very pleased with our experience. The service was impeccable, the quality of the meal was excellent, and the price was completely reasonable. Having dined at the Monte Carlo location several times previously, I had very high expectations for this new neighborhood gem. It definitely did not disappoint. My only concern was that there were a lot of small children, and this made the overall noise level high.  Would love to return to this location for dinner, and hopefully enjoy an intimate and romantic meal. PS, the wine by the glass selection is absolutely amazing.

WdQkExVn2JzxWsyG4QrOYg.text: Yum! Great food and cute and cozy ambiance! I had the salmon burger which was delish, and my dad had the gnocchi which was super rich and yummy.

I62muDCVsb9JXW3IrC97UQ.text: I love: the burger, the quiche Lorraine, the croque madame, the petals and pears cocktail. I love this place and it has become one of my favorite lunch and dinner spots near home. The house baked pastries are also wonderful and authentic. They have real croissants! Yay!

IUDG0SvJHbYvJs9_yHzDwg.text: Went here with a large group so we were able to try many different menu items. Everything was fabulous with great presentation. My favorites were the risotto, French onion soup and creme brulee. Never had the chance to make it to Andre's on the strip so I am glad we have this spot now to frequent. The staff was very friendly and very accommodating. Will definitely be back!

hRCzf0MMqQdT9FAHzrJ4nw.text: I wanted to like this place. It's Restaurant week in Vegas and I look for new places or hidden gems. What I found were streaky windows, no ambiance and no taste.  Ceasar salad was overdressed and warm. The calamari was overcooked and chewy. Steak and frites were cool not warm and just bland. The salmon was good flavor and temp but the sides a throw away. I poked fun at the dated plating style but that wasn't really bad. The chocolate souffle was good texture but tasteless. The service asked how the entree was before either of us took a bite then only returned to clear. I debated a 3 rating but when you pay over $50 each for a dinner, I think it should be good- and this wasn't. Go follow DW to their new location at the Grammercy for flavor.

dzJQ85YsmBboFWTrkShfWQ.text: World famous chef. Nice bistro in the southwest part of town. Outstanding food and staff.

ZQqibPc0AaDIOv0aGdCYkQ.text: I decided to try a different place. Due to my stomach issues I wanted to get something non spicey. So I ordered a burger and salad. Food was ok but not hot just lukewarm. Pretty expensive due to delivery price. Burger huge so it took all day to eat. Salad was awesome. French fries were quite tasty. So since watching the budget be awhile till I reorder.

1RFR9y4ckxWeB9QOAdg7OQ.text: I will start by saying SOME of the food was tasty however, service was incredibly slow. We were dining with kids and every other restaurant makes sure to at least try and have kids food out first however, the kids waited just as extremely long to get their food as everyone else. Our server asked if we were going to wait to have our food come out so we could continue to enjoy the appetizer we ordered so we he kids wouldn't starve and when I replied that we would like the food, he stated it would be right out ...20 mins later, still no food. It is a shame because there was definite potential here however, the staff seemed confused and were not very efficient. There was no effort to apologize for the long wait times or to even offer anything for the kids who were quite audibly saying "we are starving". Once the food finally did come out, it came out one separated dish at a time with the kids food last. Though our wait was over, sadly our disappointment did not end there.   The food:  French toast: brought out cold. When we sent it back, they microwaved it then walked around confused unsure of which table it went to taking it first to a different table (they sat it down in front of a different person) before picking it back up, going back to the kitchen to figure out where to take it. Once three staff discussed the conundrum, they finally brought the nuked, rubbery, dry French toast back over to our table.  Veggie quiche with side salad: they should change this to side lettuce. A plate full of mixed greens with scarce dressing. The quiche was lukewarm but had a good flavor.  Kids mac and cheese: this was an adult dish that was put on a kids menu. Most kids don't like 5 different kinds of gourmet cheeses and as a result this dish was a fail. A bubbly pile of cheese with macaroni buried inside was not a hit with the kids.  The beignets, French onion soup, and charcuterie plate were very good.   Overall, extremely long wait for food, one person in our party got nothing, and  we had to take the kids to lunch after lunch. We even had a delay getting our check and had to enlist the assistance of another server since ours was dealing with yet another complaint and computer confusion. There is potential if they figure out their servers but I won't be back any time soon.   Note: there was also a circulating gentleman with a beard who appeared to be a manager but I wouldn't know since he made no effort to check on anyone even when they were visible distressed.

e9LrvNGmGUJm2yXpTXE2SA.text: had dinner there for the first time last night since it was formerly DW Bistro.  Nice atmosphere, nice decor, happy hour menu was nice although we didn't order anything from it. We had the oysters, 2 salads and a couple of drinks. It was all good, pretty pricey; but I appreciate the caliber of restaurant in an area off strip. I am so sick of the STRIP!! I would like to try an entree next time to truly gauge this restaurant, but so far I am happy with this little neighborhood gem.

IrjiuNUAi5lZRCUhjZRF3g.text: Wonderful staff, food and atmosphere.  Great finding a spot with this kind of quality and off the strip!

NkiOKkOAPhafUaE2l9S8PQ.text: I thought I was going to DW Bistro but ended up at a new to me restaurant lunching on fine French dining. Escargot magnificent Trout Almondine  delightful great French wine list #yum. Cameron alias Pepe our waiter is fabulous!

jQx7MXnX_DP6JQp1wgH9pg.text: i found out that andre's was opening in the southwest from a bartender at the rum runner on desert inn.  i was addicted to the food there because scott sampson was the awesome chef behind all of the amazing dishes coming out from a little window in that smoky bar.  we were informed that he had left rum runner to rejoin chef andre at his new venture.  needless to say, i was eagerly awaiting the opening and i couldn't wait to sink my teeth into those duck fat fries again.  so a bunch of us went right after andre's opened.  we took advantage of the happy hour menu and we were beyond satisfied.  scott sampson has done it again and i am so glad i can just go to a restaurant and eat his food whenever i want again.  he's one of those chefs that doesn't get nearly enough credit for his talent.  his food is remarkable.  the happy hour is reasonably priced and portions are generous.  my favorite thing has to be the burger and duck fat fries.  the escargot was quite delicious too.  i can't wait to go back for more!

4J0JFi6Mgd4KQfrmlCzz3Q.text: Great off strip restaurant with Las Vegas history. Nice size ding room with pleasant decor. Wonderful French flare. The fries are a must with any dish.  Have been here several times both lunch and dinner and have enjoyed each visit.

_Zz0DBtgJaDES9yzcp5rCw.text: You must go here for weekend Brunch and have their beignets. They are delicious. The escargot is quite good also and they have unlimited booze during brunch on the weekends in the form of mimosas, rose and I some kind of special cocktail du jour.

CrS0-Y4mfl9qwbJiEX7uyA.text: Great place with awesome service. I had salmon benedict which had perfect texture and was delicious. I highly recommend their white sangria !

EmYydUWHBGwtGG9IyW4LAA.text: The best French onion soup in Vegas!  Loved every dish I ordered .Boulabase and salmon were outstanding and when I got chocolate souffle, I knew I am in love with this place.

o85s8n10Xy5dyxIAtMeCag.text: I've been here a few times and I'm always happy! The Coq au vin (fall off the bone, melt in your mouth) and lamb are delicious! Nice smaller restaurant with good atmosphere and not too noisy.

AFhrPel8bx81A7pZ16_qrg.text: Actually, 5 stars for service and 4.5 for food.  Our server was excellent.  He was super friendly and perfectly professional without being stuffy.  It's a hard balance to pull off but he was perfect.  We had the lobster roll, it's got crab meat mixed in but still excellent, served on a perfectly buttered and toasted brioche spilt top bun; lamb burger, very Greek and authentic flavors; banana foster pancakes, they adjusted for our son and subbed in maple syrup, excellent with a sour dough tang; duck fat garlic fries, crispy outside, tender inside and finished them all.  Chocolate souffle was amazing and perfectly sized.  It was on the smaller side but perfectly intense and chocolatey.  The French onion soup was a fail.  It was way too vinegary.  Very strange for them to overdo the vinegar but I'll chalk it up to a fluke.  We'll be back for another fabulous meal soon.

uykYWUv9NuOeHR5xJPfzxA.text: Had a late night Sunday dinner at Andre's last week. The service was phenomenal. My dirty martini was perfect and the steak was just right. Perfect place for a date night. I highly recommend it.

BtlTCfhsYl1Mvi-AwJagHw.text: Great traditional French cuisine.  Cheese and charcuterie plate was perfect--great pate.

3Mq3imjMJH76-l124Vcr9A.text: Delightful Sunday brunch last weekend at Andre's....  As a visitor to the desert annually, we tend to venture off strip to privateer establishments to support local business  Andre's, a bit of hike from the Strip, did not disappoint  Our table of six started with charcuterie and cheese boards and ended with a souffle, creme brulee and a lemon tart  Main brunch items included were lobster roll and fries, chicken and waffles, veggie quiche, cobb salad, chicken caesar salad and spinach omelette  The weakest dish of the bunch was the chicken and waffles imo....the waffle did not hold up well to the gravy slathered on and ended up being soft and mushy  Overall, excellent attention to detail and execution   We could have easily paid double for similar fare from Bardot Brasserie  If you have wheels, Andre's is well worth the trip

VkakK2mRURjRaPHy55OE0A.text: Seriously divine food!!! Got the mussels and OMG, probably the best meal I've had in a while!!!! Freshly squeezed juices and great service!!!

SHZdlZvgp0heUQsK-W6SDw.text: Dined here on a Tuesday night and the front dining room area was filled, but not packed.  That's a good sign, especially on a Tuesday for a suburbia eatery.  We sat in a corner spot that faced a faux brick wall.  The seating was comfortable, but I wasn't thrilled with the corner ambiance.  It had no windows, so I felt a little claustrophobic.  As for the food and service, everything was delicious.  I had the Mixed Green Salad and a 6oz. Filet.  Both were prepared perfectly!  The steak was cooked medium, like I asked.  This seems to be a difficult task for a lot of restaurants, but Andre's Bistro delivered a meal exactly as I wanted.  This spot will be my new neighborhood go to gem!

VJ8-KrOUKThAXECwpacXmQ.text: We had a nice welcome when we walked in and great service at the bar. We started off with these crispy fried frog legs and duck fat fries. We had the mushroom risotto and the Andre Burger for dinner. We ended with the Gran Marnier Souffle, recommended by the Bartender. It was scrumptious.  Every bit of it was 5 stars. We will be back!

-3dWhoofSGQO27JGkcIVNw.text: Go for brunch! Went a few weeks ago and it was bomb. Thought $10 for 5 pastries was a little steep but it was worth it - loved the plain croissant and almond pastry. I got the eggs Benedict and it was way better than average because of the cut and flavor of the ham - so tasty. Also the coffee was good (way better than typical diner coffee) and all the cups, plates, settings, etc. are very colorful and cute.

_OZ_gGAlH5_yp0iaSAlSDg.text: We tried this place for lunch. It was great! We had French onion soup, which is one of my favorites, and this place nailed it! One of my favorites in Vegas. Also had the cheeseburger w/ fries. It all was delicious and hot! Service was also great! I will definitely be back!

Y8TGr6dj2VywTxZumCVILA.text: Came here this afternoon for brunch with some girlfriends. The overall atmosphere is decent, the decor is cute, and the food was not good. I ordered the French onion soup as a starter and it was bad. The cheese part was good but past that, the rest of the soup was too salty and it had some very harsh herbs that made it taste bitter. The waffles were not my favorite, the were very very very hard. Every bite made me feel like I was biting into cardboard. The pieces were so hard to chew and the syrup slipped right off of them because there was nothing to absorb the liquid due to the firmness of the waffle. The service was average, its hard to judge service on a larger party especially because some people in our party were late so the server had to keep coming back and wasn't sure how long to wait to come back each time to see if we were ready yet. Not her fault, so can't really speak on how the regular service is. Probably wouldn't come back due to the fact that the food just wasn't impressive at all. Wouldn't definitely recommend you skip this place when southwest has sooo many other brunch places that are incredible.

8X9jHX7GfuUTJbenADE30A.text: So excited to have Andre's on the west side of town!   The food was excellent had the Fois Gras, Wild Mushroom Risotto and the Chocolate Souffle.  All we amazing, can't wait to go back this weekend for brunch !

tKF3WOyvpdWYIG-p4FsC3g.text: My husband I went in for dinner and were very impressed. A unique menu without being intimidating and everything we ordered was delicious. I really want to go back and try the brunch.

3-vD7xbD9XbtStH4srTVDg.text: Went back for a special occasion and Andre's did not disappoint.  The service was great and the food was outstanding.  I think we ordered just about everything: charcuterie platter, onion soup, escargot, Caesars salad, Bouillabaisse, steak, salmon, lamb shank, lobster roll and the dessert flight.  Each item was cooked perfectly.  Take the time to visit, this place is excellent.

2isGuu6cW56Gv8muT0l8qQ.text: It seems that amazing Las Vegas has more talented chefs per capita than any other destination in the world. And the talent isn't confined to the Strip or even to the city itself. I've found outstanding dining  in every suburban nook and cranny and the prime example of this is Andre's Bistro in Spring Valley.   Andre's is in a non-descript shopping center on the edge of Spring Valley, near the Wet and Wild water park, and is a bit of a car drive for many people living in the Vegas valley as well as for travelers staying in Strip-accessible lodgings. It's unpretentiously chic, with the ambience of a classic French bistro but, in keeping with the bistro tradition, the food is the True shining star of Andre's.   Andre Rochat is a bit of a Vegas culinary icon. He ran Andre's, his Michelin star namesake restaurant at the Monte Carlo, until it closed in 2016. Andre's Bistro, run by Rochat's former employees in partnership with him, is the incarnation of Andre's in name and spirit. It's not as fancy or as expensive as the Andre's at Monte Carlo was - I think of it as the acoustic version - all of the quality stripped down to the essential of providing great food.  I started the night with an OG Mai Tai, prepared the way I like it; tart, not too sweet, and as smooth as liquid silk. I loved the maraschino cherry garnish, they use the real kind, not the radioactive fluorescent ones. It was the best mai tai I've ever had, the night was off to a good start.   The menu is classic French, not Cal-French, so they don't do anything odd or extravagant here. I was pleased to see Dover Sole on the menu ($55, that's a rare find). I started with the Spring Risotto ($22, $15 for happy hour) made with ramps,  brussel sprouts, and goat cheese. It's served al dente (as stated on the menu) and, while I wasn't used to the crunch in the rice, it wasn't unpleasant. The risotto itself was hearty and vibrant, imbued with the earthiness of the ramps and brussel sprouts. I loved the burst of sweetness the tomatoes provided. Overall, it was a well-rounded dish, surprisingly, crunchy rice and all.   Next I moved on to the Moules Frites ($15 for happy hour), made with PEI mussels, garlic, parsley, saffron, and cream. It is served with a side of duck fat fries that were perfectly flavorful and crisp. The mussels theselves were fresh and clean tasting and greatly enhanced by a delicious broth that I couldn't stop sopping up with my bread. My dining companion got the Potato Gnochhi and it was the lightest, fluffiest gnocchi I've ever had. All the dishes were delicious, but I'd say the gnocchi was the big winner of the night.   Andre's also has a full stocked bar and a decent wine list with French labels at reasonable prices. In summary, the restaurant is a local gem. The values during happy hour are insane and include Saturdays from 3pm - 6pm. It's destination dining for both visitors and locals looking for high-end,  Strip quality food in a comfortably non-bougey setting. Andre's Bistro has happily earned a place in my regular rotation, especially during happy hours.

CRyIkyQvcSEH2A586tnqJg.text: Jose was our server. He wasn't pleasant by the end of our dining experience.  My husband and I went for Saturday Brunch. He gave small joking remarks when I said I will just have water for drinks and when I paid for the meal at the end of the meal, he tossed the check with my $71 change attached on the table as he walked by and kept walking. Jose the waiter made us feel unwanted at Andre's Bistro.  My husband ordered iron steak medium well, It was well done.  I ordered eggs Benedict and French toast with WATER.  We always give 20% tip but today was only 10% thanks to our waiters attitude throwing my money on the table without a word.  Now I feel that was too much.  We definitely won't be back.

syYGdnInFTEb5V_vnRtY4A.text: Great for brunch! Food is tasty and staff is very friendly and attentive! Bottomless mimosas and great Bloody Mary.   Edit: 5/27/18, We are always so surprised we are able to just walk into this place on Sunday's. Everything we have ever ordered from here has always been really tasty, I had ordered a King Crab Benedict with avocado instead of asparagus and man it's one of the best Benedict's I've had! The staff as always is very attentive and friendly!

5MryDnq82DTGpqLrbT-xsw.text: Sometimes you want a really good meal, without having to travel to the Strip. Thank goodness for off-Strip restaurants like Andre's Bistro & Bar.  I came here with my husband for a brunch date. The setting was very intimate. We had the option of dining al fresco style or inside. Although the weather was perfect, we asked for a table towards the back of the restaurant for more privacy.  Andre's Bistro has a wonderful staff that caters to a sophisticated local crowd.   The restaurant had New Orleans style jazz piped in, so I though it was only fitting to order the beignets. It made me feel as though I'd been transported to the Big Easy. Our server suggested the spinach omelette, which had tomatoes, goat cheese, spinach and mushrooms, plus breakfast potatoes. My husband opted for the salmon burger with sweet potato fries. Both entrees had a ton of flavor!!For dessert, we shared the Saturday Sundae and the chocolate souffle. The souffle took about 20 minutes, but was totally worth it. The sundae was made with homemade vanilla ice cream, brownies, hot fudge, caramel sauce and hazelnuts. It sort of reminded me of a praline sundae. Overall, this was the perfect meal!

8N65jjaOqekAQ4hvhwxTAA.text: Great vibe/decor, eclectic menu and a great bartender (Cameron).    Very cool, chill, casual but upscale vibe in the establishment.  The menu is always being revised so don't expect some of the items on yelp to be available. Still, the menu won't disappoint.    We weren't super hungry so I had escargot with duck fat fries and my wife had the lobster role with sweet potato fries.  Everything was very good. The duck fat fries were bomb!     What made the night for us was the bartender, Cameron.  We will be back to hang with him again and enjoy his libations.

OAY5J-VxzdaNMacpGrIi4A.text: We come here quite often for brunch and I ALWAYS forget to yelp the great experiences. The staff are all so nice and approachable. They all help each other out with drinks and food. We typically come on Sundays for Brunch. We always have the same waiter but I don't remember his name. Older gentlemen that has worked there for quite a while. So sweet and funny. Bottomless mimosas are a must! It is pricey but the food is high quality and so are the drinks.  The bar is beautiful and so is the restaurant. Clean and beautifully decorated. It is a great place to go for a date or special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch!

4oF40TbYM56thJRCluJ0MQ.text: Pretty decent but not all that. We won't be back.   I took my my girlfriend on a date and wanted it to be a French restaurant. I liked the atmosphere, it was pretty cute and cozy, I liked ambience of the place - great music, perfect loudness (not too quite but can comfortably talk).  Service - 4 stars. It was good but just not fast enough. Everybody took their time. Our server and busboy were very friendly though.  Food - it was okay. Not bad but in my opinion it wasn't great. I don't have any desire to come back  We ordered: * French onion soups - barely any cheese crust. It tasted pretty decent but there was zero richness to it. I finished it. My girlfriend didn't eat the soup, said it was very plain for her taste. She prefers a richer taste. If you ever had a French onion soup, then you know what I'm talking about.  * their Sunday special - duck (can't remember full name of the dish). Its supposed to be served with foie Gras, waffle, and orange glaze. Since I ordered the dish on a Saturday, they didn't have waffles. They replaced it with mashed potatoes (upon my request). I liked the dish but I most certainly didnt think it was worth $35. A few tiny slices of duck (i was hoping it would have crispy skin but alas!), 3 tiny pieces of foie gras, some mashed potatoes and spinach (spinach was a good touch). I was pleasantly surprised with orange glaze, it was made with duck broth, was thick and flavorful, and tasted delicious. Like I said, I liked the dish but it was NOT worth $35. * my girlfriend ordered caeser salad and said it was pretty plain. She kept adding salt and pepper. Said like something was missing. She finished the salad but said that it was nothing special and she wouldn't order it again.   Drinks: full bar. I ordered bloody Mary and was not happy. It was super bitter and strong, barely had any spice and flavor. My girlfriend ordered beer, it was fine.   So I liked the place, it was great for a date in terms of service, ambience, & atmosphere. They also have a full bar which was great. However, both my gf and are didn't find food good enough to ever want to come back, so we'll be looking for other French restaurants.

eB5VNpoZ0xrvjLaxMVuLhA.text: Andre's Bistro & Bar is located at the previous DW Bistro's location.  The layout is almost identical yet the ambience is a markedly improved with richer, deeper tones....French Bistro tones, if you will.  While the dinner experience is rather sexy and romantic, lunch time is upbeat and casual. I have been in multiple times for both lunch and dinner. On my latest visit, my girlfriend and I came in for lunch and ordered the Lobster Roll and Cobb Salad. The Lobster Roll was well seasoned, with chunks of Lobster wrapped up with warm, crispy bread.  It came with garlic French fires...I wish I would have asked to substitute with a salad, as I'm not much of a fry eater. The Cobb Salad showed up with bountiful amounts of bacon and chicken. My friend loved her salad very much. Our waiter brought us a warm baguette and butter as we finished our meals...almost felt like an after thought.  All the dishes I've had over 4 times visits has been nothing but delicious. I would like to come on a Wednesday for their mid-week brunch between 10am to 3:30pm.  I am both proud and grateful that Vegas locals have chef Rochart and his team off the strip and in this neighborhood.   -2017 review #52-

N0bR3ZPspCkJ2YxV1LMY5g.text: Oh my goodness order the French dip for lunch. I can't believe it's only $9.50. The meet is so tender and the bread is flaky soft and fresh. I loved the horseradish sauce it paired perfectly. It had that little bit of kick that helped with just an all meat sandwich. Instead of au jus it's served with French onion soup minus the cheese. The dip was really flavorful but it didn't even need it. I only dipped every other bite if that. It also served with a basket of homemade chips. The bf ordered the lobster roll which has a mix of blue crab in it. It didn't have too much mayo which is good and it didn't have pieces of veggies which is also good. It was citrusy and meaty. It was served in a buttered what looked like Texas toast. They have Stella on tap.  One last thing service was awesome. Got there as soon as they opened and our server was very welcoming and helpful with answering our questions.

JU58Vt8bZo3Lh_Jb8fNp2A.text: Great food and service at Andre's Bistro & Bar! They offer a vegan risotto that is delish that I paired with salmon- yummy! They offer many delicious desserts too.

Um-bR1Ep4G2x-Gfdquogrw.text: I have nothing good to say about this place. First off... my mom called for almost a month trying to make a reservation for tea. The phone, even though she called after 3pm, always went to an answering machine. She left multiple messages with no return phone call. Finally, I was able to reach someone via Facebook. We made our reservation for today for afternoon tea. We expected, based off the reviews, that it was going to be good. Wow were we wrong! First off they set us at a table that only fit 4 people, there were 5 of us, so everyone was bumping elbows. We sat there for awhile before finally someone came by and asked if we wanted drinks from the bar. Our waiter,Christian, finally showed up with a box to pick our tea. Everyone chose one and my 7yr old was offered hot chocolate, which made her happy. Christian came by with warm bread and butter for our table but no water for our tea bags. We waited about another 10-15 mins for hot water. He brought the water in silver tea kettles that were tarnished, now I'm not sure if they were meant to be like that or now but to me it was not to my liking. I waited for a tea cup for my mom and myself and instead of bringing me a tea cup, Christian brings me a glass of ice water!! What do you want me to do with that? Finally he brought one for me but not my mom. I finally had enough and went and grabbed one off the table behind us. They offered two different soup options, we all chose the French onion. This is one thing I can't complain too much about except I wished it had more cheese. It was yummy!!  The chef came by with our trays of scones and sandwiches but we had to remind her to bring the cream, curd, and preserves. The sandwiches were very good, I didn't like the salmon was warm and very chewy but the chicken salad and egg salad were really good! We constantly had to ask for hot water and I asked for ice water but he forgot more then once.   The desserts came and in my opinion were pathetic and not very good for a tea service. The ladies at the table next to us received a little chocolate cake like dessert while we got cookies and raspberry meringue cookies... none of which were good.   The service was terrible, the food wasn't that great, and the atmosphere wasn't good either. For what we spent on the tea I expected way more then what we got!

UGlNUf96RFMRsd2vGZX33g.text: We arrived right on time for our 6:00 reservation and were quickly seated. Water and bread arrived while we looked over the menu. I think we got different bread than Sheila G did because it was just okay. And then we waited and waited with no one coming over. We finally flagged someone down and asked if anyone was working our table. He said "I can take your order". Ok then.   We started off with some french wine and the french onion soup. For the entrees we ordered the trout almandine and the Ribeye steak. They ask you to order the souffle in advance which we did. A short time later another server came over and apologized telling us she had no idea she had our table. It is a pretty small restaurant with only a couple servers but I let it go as an honest mistake.   Being at a french bistro with a french chef we had high hopes for the onion soup. Unfortunately it was a let down. Where's all the cheese?? It was baked on the outside of the bowl instead of inside with the onions and broth. There was some on the bread as well but I like a lot of cheese IN the soup. The entrees came out and the trout was presented very nicely with potatoes and green beans. I do agree with Sheila G that it just needed some more flavor. It was good, but not great. The green beans were cooked perfectly crisp. The ribeye was also good, cooked as ordered and tender.   Finally the souffle came out and looked amazing. Surprisingly, even with the chocolate sauce I thought it wasn't sweet enough. The actual souffle was lacking chocolate flavor, but it was cooked perfectly.   Andre's was a strong 3 stars for me, but I wouldn't be in any rush to return. Nothing stood out as amazing or outstanding. It was also very warm inside which I don't like when I am eating.

plaiQVR1Y-K1FODE8mPZVg.text: Andre's is a welcome addition to the Vegas dining scene! The food quality coupled with reasonable prices prove that "you don't need a silver fork to eat good food," - a quote  by Paul Prudhomme featured on their exterior that encapsulates what Andre's has to offer.   HAPPY HOUR: My first visit for HH was stellar. Bar seating, TV tuned to a Spurs game, attentive but unobtrusive service, and incredible food. The frog legs ($8) were a pleasant start to the meal but Andre's burger (a $7 steal!) stole the show, with gooey gruyere, red onion marmalade, and truffle mayo coming together to combine the flavors of a burger with French onion soup. The sturdy pretzel roll held up well, too.  It was marvelous and that burger was on my mind for days. Days!   BRUNCH: Came with a group and tried several dishes but was less impressed. Standouts were the escargots (so garlicky, request extra bread!), Artisanal Sausage Platter (loved the lamb!), the crispy Liege-style Belgian waffles, classic French Onion soup, duck fat fries, and the desserts (order the souffle ahead of time). Unfortunately, several dishes were marred by cooking errors. The Chicken and Waffles featured a great gravy but limp waffles and soggy chicken, while Andre's Classic Benedict was skimpy on the ham and unremarkable other than the side of crispy potatoes. Most of the items on a friend's charcuterie board went unfinished while a burger was received at the wrong temperature. Our server wasn't around much and refills had to be requested but he was pleasant enough. Perhaps they were understaffed.   "First we eat, then we do everything else," (MFK Fisher)- The dishes I liked I really liked and would return for, while I remain hopeful that a future dinner visit will fare better than brunch in terms of execution and satisfaction.   TIP: Happy Hour is 3:30-5:30, daily. It's the only time the Bistro Hot Dog is available; it's made in-house and regularly sells out. I've yet to have it but hear it's worth the wait.

8s8QqFICywOqzh2cBZT0Kg.text: Looking for a place with bottomless mimosas for a Sunday girls day brunch that's opened passed 2pm (and they are open for brunch on Saturdays & Sundays from 10:00am to 3:30pm)... AND THIS PLACE DID NOT DISAPPOINT! The venue was cute, the service was attentive, the food was flavorful and we definitely got our day fade in with their bottomless mimosas! *hiccup*  They offer bottomless "all-you-can-drink" brunch with: - 25$ MIMOSAS - 22$ ROSE - 20$ HOMEMADE PUNCH  In terms of eats, my eye went straight for:  - LOBSTER ROLL ($18.00): Maine lobster, fine herbs on a buttery toasted bread roll. Comes with your choice of duck fat fries or a green salad. (I went with the salad, but ended up ordering a side of the fries when I sampled my friends -- which was $8, ouch!) - CHICKEN & WAFFLES ($16.00): Buttermilk fried chicken, corn bread waffles with a side of country gravy.   Would we come back? Definitely! :)  PRO TIP: They also have a happy hour menu from 3:30-5:30!

PEJGQLtAUZqxfvxuJhwFIA.text: I was expecting more from my meal, especially given early rave reviews, but brunch fell flat.  Andre's Bistro and Bar is a fairly new location in Southwest Las Vegas carrying on the French cuisine of a local institution that used to be on the Strip for a time, and reportedly started out downtown a few decades ago. I was invited to brunch with several Yelp friends and leapt at the chance to try out what really should have been a better meal.  Drip Coffee ($3): good coffee, not that much bitterness, enjoyed it just fine as a black unsweetened coffee as I am wont to do these days, but I had to ask for refills twice before getting more coffee.  Bread with butter (complimentary): a very promising start, with an exceptional sliced baguette and a puck of creamy butter. It was confusing that only part of the table received this offering at the start, while the rest of us had to bide our time until around the arrivals of the appetizers/sides, but it was well worth the wait.  Duck Fat Fries (unsure of side dish price, was grazing on a friend's): the texture was reasonable good, but you'll definitely taste duck fat in every bite. Garlic was also plentiful. Ketchup was standard and came in a relatively small amount; fortunately, it wasn't necessary  Escargots de Bourgogne ($12): six snails served in those ceramic circular plates with indentations. Very good flavors from the herbs and garlic butter and not too chewy. The extra sauce complemented the complimentary baguette quite well too. Despite the cost, I'd order it again.  Andres Classic Benedict ($14): I enjoyed this in the moment, but it really feels like a small portion compared to similarly priced eggs Benedict at similar local spots. The Benedict was tasty and the yolk was runny, but the English muffin was unremarkable and the ham was especially sparse considering how thinly it was sliced. I had to do some excessive manipulation to get ham onto every quarter portion of the muffin. The potatoes were quite awesome, but a side dish does not a great entree make (and the potato portion was also small compared to something like Kitchen Table).  Chicken and Waffles ($16 on menu, but $14 on receipt): flavors were mostly right, although I just couldn't figure out how the (delicious, by the way) Southern-style gravy was supposed to be compatible with the syrup. The main issue is that the dish fell flat on textures. The fried chicken batter had the feel of flour, which shouldn't happen at all even if it's made of flour. The chicken itself was oddly too tender - not mushy, but it just didn't have the heft of being meat. The waffles - love the cornbread composition, by the way - could've been a little more crisp.  Chocolate Pot De Creme ($8): pretty good dessert. Smooth throughout, in both the chocolate and the cream topping. Didn't fall into the trap of tasting like boxed chocolate pudding, which was an issue at another local restaurant but the chocolate could be richer and/or darker. The vanilla "cookie" garnish was a bit ephemeral, but fun, and the mint garnish was nice but overpowering if actually eaten.  Grand Marnier Souffle ($12): great dessert overall. Fluffy, lemony, tableside presentation including a hole poked into the top and cream poured into that indentation. Pricey, but likely worth it if you're a fan of the dessert.  Small aforementioned issues aside, service was reasonable. There was a 18% auto-gratuity for our larger group. The receipt has an offer for 10% off lunch (Mon-Fri 11:30am-3:30pm) for a group of up to 6. Decor was welcoming enough, and televisions presumably can be tuned to major sporting competitions, although I wouldn't call ESPN's coverage of college softball that much of a must-see event.  Whether it was flaws in execution (such as the decidedly non-bleu cooking temperature of my tablemate's burger) or overarching recipe issues, my particular meal at Andre's Bistro and Bar did not meet my high expectations. Thus, I can't say that "I'm a fan," although I'd rate my experience 3.5 stars if that were possible on Yelp. That said, I'll keep the place in mind for a revisit because of the praise I've heard and read for other menu items.

hQ19GCVXetX732oN1MRfWA.text: My husband and I can't WAIT to come back to Andre's Bistro.  I first read about Andre's when we got the news Alize was closing. We loved the food at Alize but the ambiance was a bit too formal for everyday ventures.  Andre was mentioned in the article and the bistro sounded like a dream come True. Contemporary french in our neighborhood? We knew we had to try!  We were not disappointed.  Cute, trendy ambiance. Intimate but casual at the same time. GREAT drinks (french 75s served in coupes are our faaaave), and food was reasonably priced. We had the oysters, french onion soup, lobster roll, and some sausage dish (my husband).  We wanted a quick-ish dinner and they got us out of there in an hour without a rush! We can't wait to come back and try more dishes!

bSIBQ1-h8cQetVYJrPoxaA.text: Tried Andres last week for brunch. Went in Saturday for the first time. It was great!  The beignets were wonderful.  I had an omelette and my mom had the quiche. All of it was served hot and quick and tasted great.  I will definitely return to give dinner a try.

ZA-9hVrsoLCKDJhzMJObEg.text: Four of us met to enjoy brunch at Andre's this past Saturday morning.  Chef De Leon Lopez was given carte blanche to cook for the table.  The dishes served were:  Baguette with farm butter. Beignets. House made pastries. Escargots de Bourgogne.  Charcuterie platter. Brown sugar glazed bacon. Classic eggs Benedict. Andre's salmon Benedict. Croque madame. Quiche Lorraine. Vegetable quiche. Chicen and waffles. Foie gras. Lobster roll with fries. Lobster roll with salad. Flatiron steak frites. Lemon tart. Sunday sundae. Root beer float. Walnut cake. Creme brulee.  There wasn't one thing on this list I wouldn't recommend.  This was my first time to Andre's new spot and I was blown away.  Even the chicken and waffles were very, very good!  I will point out a few things I would order again.  Without a doubt, I'd get the foie gras, the lobster roll with fries, escargots, beignets, and the lemon tart.  For me, those were the standouts.  Service was excellent.  Water glasses were constantly refilled and our coffee cups never wanted for refilling.  Now that I've had the brunch offerings, it will soon be time to go back for dinner service,  It's great having a French restaurant that's a quick 10 minute drive from home.

jKw9quxfRYGLrierUOSlWg.text: Came for dinner with my wife for date night. Very nice ambiance and their custom drink menu is extensive. Had some appetizers and dinner. The ribeye was delicious. No sauce needed. There is a drizzle of honey around the plate and it actually was nice to give a little sweet touch to the salty crust of the steak. Spinach, mashed potatoes and green beans sides were good. Enough for 2 people to share.   Overall, nice dinner/date spot. Would be good for a big group too as they have sections that look like they'd be fun for larger groups. My wife is a vegetarian, so the options were not as extensive as mine, but her risotto was good and the gnocchi is the next choice to try on our next visit.

Lz2IzM-R2C_e606m6ILfTg.text: Omg! Take me to Paris! Food was delicious,  we had the Benedict, chicken and waffles, shuffle and some beignets to go. All were amazing! No complaints, it was our 1st time here and will be back for dinner soon!

jMlFzrjANVZu80i_B9pLMg.text: My second lunch here,  hubby's first. Everything was delicious and service excellent. From the sweet butter and warm mini baguette, veggie terrine starter, Frisee salad with duck Condit, lamb burger to chocolate shuffle dessert.  To for for duck fat fries. No ketchup for those fries for me, they ate way too tasty on their own. Can't wait to try dinner here.

iOI_vafHrkfNz0THyTmcNg.text: Great food, great wine and great service! Ricardo was our waiter, friendly, prompt and attentive. Ordered frog legs (first time ever having them, found them wonderfully crispy and tender), trout almandine (delicious sauce, moist fish) and beet salad (light, crispy first course). I wish the cocktail prices were a little lower to match the other restaurants  nearby, but it isn't a huge deal. If you want to stop by I highly recommend the french onion soup and potato gnocchi. The last time I visited I brought my dog and we sat on the patio with no problems. Overall it's a great semi-upscale neighborhood restaurant and I'll be back for more gnocchi soon!

187r0Cdzazpj_qQRTmAcRQ.text: Disappointing experience. Nice location and atmosphere but food was below average and our order was incorrect not once, not twice but three times. Unfortunately, will not be returning.
