sYTcoXTZ4bfdvkAw_7yCgQ.text: Im not one to give negative feedback but this was a bit disturbing. First off, i walked in and stood there for a couple minutes and not one person approached me, welcomed me, acknowledged that i was there, nor asked if I have been helped. So i was just standing there staring at the menus, and mind you i work at the hospital as a nurse so i came in and expect to get right out for a quick lunch break, but still nothing, and it wasnt at all busy. So i approached the bar and finally made eye-contact with the bartender and said i was there for pick up.  I received the bill $17 something. i paid with $20 and said just to keep the change. All she said was "do you atleast want the receipt?" No thank you or nothing. Im driving and actually took a look at the bill and this is what really burst my bubble. They charged 18% gratuity ! ... for a Chicken Sandwhich! For a bill of ONE PERSON! FOR AN ORDER FOR PICK UP! Blew my mind, i have never seen any establishment charge gratuity for a one person one sandwhich take out bill. so basically i paid for TWO TIPS, in which they were actually undeserving of it given the lack of hospitality and unfriendly bartending service (blonde hair, no smile whatsoever). Im more so obligated to give 1 star on here but if it was up to me no star. Unbelievable.

LvV9P6O-N2Yo8nyBLFdrgg.text: Service was excellent, food was so delicious! The best Duck fat fries! The mussels were so flavorful and very beautifully presented. A very relaxed feel toned down fine dining. We sat on patio and still had excellent service. The burger was delicious as well! Highly recommend there desserts as well! Saturday Sundae!!

psK0KzzL_vJpPpKDIGKSDQ.text: I don't get it. People who's opinion I respect rave about this place.  I'm going to try this again soon, but only because the food critics can't all be wrong! However, I won't take a large group here again until I've had a good experience - all but one person in the group I took was disappointed and frankly, surprised at the poor execution.  Absolutely everything was wrong when I took a group of 8 here. One of our group was a chef, so I was particularly embarrassed I'd planned this dinner out.  The food was decent, but the numerous mistakes on nearly every order combined with the server errors in judgment and tactics made for an unpleasant experience. Just a small sampling of numerous mistakes made: several people got the wrong dish - when one came out wrong a second time, the server stated the first dish was still in the back and he could go get it again! I ordered mussels, and had to ask for a bowl for shells, then use the spoon they brought me instead of a fork. We had to keep picking up our plates and handing them to the server so he'd take them away. A medium rare steak was medium well.   And what is with the space on the side that looks like a soup kitchen? We all loved the dining and bar area, but couldn't figure out what the other room was about.

Nehuh-AHpHV1sULUOTsYSA.text: 1/2 Ambiance - The lighting needs a little improvement  Service - Hostess (Ally) , Food Server (Thomas) , Buspersons  1/2 Food - Fois Gras was tasty, Wife had the Trout and was delicious with a healthy serving, I had the 10oz NY Strip (I asked for Medium Rare, but was closer to Medium), duck fat fries was tasty, and the chocolate souffle was awesome.  Good luck and congrats John and Chef Marty!

uSqeEQQ_JeODg3F44SNang.text: Went here for my husband's vacation dinner and was pleasantly surprised by the food and ambiance.  Andre's had a romantic. darkly lit vibe, great for dates and couples.  We started out with a cocktail, can't remember the name but it had ginger syrup.  The flavor reminded me of Chinese medicine tonics, not too bad.  There was plenty of french bread and butter.  Be careful not to fill up on that. The escargots was OK, it was covered in a parsley butter sauce, a little different.  The 'piece de resistance' was the Andre burger, it was moist flavorful, well seasoned and not a hint of dryness.  Definitely one of the best burgers we've ever had.  The duck fat fries were yummy, so were the sweet potato fries.  The fois gras hot dog was fine, though the burger beat it out.  The desserts were pot du creme, a fairly rich chocolate mousse and creme brulee.  Both were excellent.  We were the waitress's suggestion and took a bite from each to mix it up.    The best thing was the bill was only $43 including tip because of the 3-6pm happy hour special.  Each entree was only $7 the burger, escargots and gourmet dog.  The main entrees were a little more.  The desserts were $4 each.  Must remind myself to try the souffle next time.

o6u2roS92fI3zJYbcHAndQ.text: Wasn't really impress - the food has really potential to be good but sims like their chef is not really professional.  The burger was bellow decent -I asked medium and it came well-well done. The trout was really not fresh and my wife really suffer from bad a stomach ache that night- not going to report this to the health dep anyway. Drinks are really good and up shelf,bread and batter came very fresh and tasted good-the staff is really friendly . Probably will be back in 6 month to check it again but for now $120 for 2 people can get us a better place with a better meal.

n_n73V9DGMeQCikpJGflYg.text: Family Saturday Brunch at Andre's Bistro. We sat on the patio and brought our bull dog puppy to enjoy the gorgeous spring weather. I shared the croque madame with duck fat fries and eggs benedict with breakfast potatoes with my sister, my niece had the chicken and waffles and more importantly, the little boy my niece is baby sitting is highly lactose intolerant and the bistro staff and chef were able to accommodate his diet by making special non-dairy kids chicken fingers!!! Thank you for taking the extra step in showing great customer service! We will be back Andre's Bistro

vr0Eni2nRryYZ6EYkpFovg.text: My fav spot for a good steak and a craft cocktail. The wine list is delicious. I'm a big fan of patios and dog friendly places. Its a good balance. I can park my bicycle after a nice ride with my pup and enjoy a super fancy meal. Great sangria.

o10BOWRzgr9ZlJQC2_d7Kw.text: Literally my favorite restaurant in Vegas. the food is incredible, all of it; oysters, seafood, steaks, not a bad thing on the menu. The staff is incredible, waiters and bartenders know what they are talking about and provide incredible service. you can order the food to your home as well. there is not one thing i would change about this place. amazing.

S1fZTgqnfVQPPiePu8qVCQ.text: Trying to not only give industry money to worthy businesses but also to diversify co-worker's palates with #supportlocal it was thrilling when one of the staff requested Coq au Vin for her birthday on Tuesday, and although she did not recall where the dish had been tasted previously the team at Andre's Bistro and Bar were happy to make wishes come True.  Currently closed on weekday afternoons for renovation, the announcement of what's to come not yet made but apparently exciting, it was after speaking with General Manager Joe Marsco and providing a budget that a menu was left in the hands of Chefs Chris Bulen and Kevin Lopez, the latter making delivery right on time complete with an abundance of plates, utensils and napkins.  Not a place to cut corners in terms of Ingredients or presentation whether on-site or catering, insulated chafing dishes holding temperatures for nearly three hours until Chef Lopez returned to pack leftovers and collect serviceware, it was starting with housemade Baguettes and good Butter that some filled their plate with Salad, the fresh mix at first confusing some who assuming a bottle of Dressing was Gravy but widely praised later when topped in bitter-sweet Vinaigrette.  Focused next on Sides, most of the staff unfamiliar with French Cuisine but happy to learn by way of silky Mashed Potatoes, it was surprising that many also gravitated to tender Potato Dumplings set against Butternut Squash and Sauteed Spinach, the herbaceous sauce far better than when last experienced at the Restaurant and an absolutely wonderful choice for those averse to Meat.    Onward to Entrees, the Chicken quite literally slipping off bones amidst Onions, Mushrooms and Bacon in Chicken Jus, those seeking something even heartier took immense pleasure in crispy Pork that some staff called Chicharrones, though regardless of language the thick nuggets of Pork Belly were stunning atop Onions and Apples cooked down with Calvados.  Specially requesting a Birthday Cake to finish, Pastry Chef Tammy Alana's work always sure to impress, it was no different this time than so many meals at Andre's or Alize that everything looked and tasted amazing as moist Chocolate Sponge stood springy between layers of Milk Chocolate Buttercream and thick Cocoa Ganache.

NHzAxbj6kfWnP5pqHPdyjg.text: This fine dining (from Monte Carlo) turned neighborhood bistro and bar is truly a hidden gem. Scored a Groupon deal and ended up here for a brunch one weekend. Ordered the Lyonnaise with Duck Confit, Flat Iron Steak with Duck Fat Fries and a drip coffee with the cutest presentation to enjoy al freso. Bf asked for other sauces to go with the fries and the truffle aioli went amazing with the duck fat fries.  Everything was delicious! Duck Confit was a little overwhelming for me on top of the steak and duck fat fries, so may hold off next time. Be sure to order the souffle at the beginning as it takes 20 min to prep. I got the half chocolate half grand Marnier... recommend the latter between the two. Fantastic service. A little on the pricier side so I would recommend getting the Groupon. I personally will definitely be returning for happy hour!   Get there soon because Chef Andre has officially decided to retire according to our server. Menu options will remain the same with just a few changes.

kfdvaaLPIUH3E5l77xle-g.text: Another Yelper told me about Andre's Bistro and I'm so glad she did. I enjoyed my brunch so much that I returned for a second brunch later the same week. I hope to return for dinner in the near future.   The service was great during both of my visits. Service was attentive and friendly. There weren't long waits for food or anything we needed.   The Lobster Roll had great flavor and didn't hold back on the lobster. The perfectly toasted roll rounded it off. Our side of sweet potato fries were crispy and delicious. The Chicken and Waffles made with cornbread waffles were also very good. The chicken was nicely breaded and seasoned. I liked that the dish was served with both syrup and a gravy. The Sausage & Gruyere Cheese Frittata was a good meal overall with potatoes on the side, but not the most exciting meal they offer. The Beignets were light and airy with plenty of powdered sugar. The lemon curd on the side was delicious.   Even for brunch the dessert menu offers nine different options making this my kind of place. Andre's Classic Souffle was nicely presented with the sauce poured over the top tableside. It was good, but wasn't one of the best desserts I've had. No worries, the Lemon Tart on my second visit was one of the best desserts I've ever had! The lemon filling was perfectly tart and paired well with the flavorful sugar cookie crust. I loved that the top was lightly bruleed too. I'm sad that my husband and I were trying to be good and shared only one. Next time I'm getting my own.

vbPSCf7QrWa4qaJelWL6sw.text: Andre's Bistro serves up quite a brunch!  My lucky charm and I gathered for a Sunday brunch to a welcoming restaurant.  Our waiter, Nate, was funny and friendly.  He definitely did his job well and I appreciated his quality service.   Of course everything on the menu looked appetizing, we opted to share the Chicken & Waffles and Lobster Roll to start.  The lobster had a great citrus flavor and filled the toasted roll wonderfully.  The ingredients were fresh simply delightful!  I absolutely loved the breading on the chicken.  It had a nice pepper fried into the moist piece of chicken. The accompanied waffles just put it over the top.  They were made from corn bread batter which is always a favorite of mine.  I would highly recommend either one of these delicious plates.    I was full. I was satisfied! Thank you Nate and Andre's for a lovely brunch!

W69Oce9VC1x4g_nEuasLeQ.text: Andres is a causal way to get into French Cuisine without the stuffiness or sky high prices. They have one of the best happy hour In town and daily specials that are great deals.   The atmosphere is modern yet welcoming. The service is outstanding and they work hard to meet and anticipate your needs.   We've sampled starters such as the escargot, French onion soup, frog legs, and the charcuterie board. All the starters have been fantastic, with exception of the frog legs which were only good.   The entrees we've tried are the Andre's burger, the lamb burger, and the coco au vin (chicken braised in wine) all have been expertly prepared and delicious. The Andre's burger is a stand out with fresh ingredients, quality meat, a wonderful bun, and perfectly cooked. The cocktails, (French 75 and their version of the Mai Tai) are strong and tasty showing creativity, the pino noir is amazing, but their coffee needs work. The chocolate souffle is sumptuous, rich, and the perfect way to end a great meal.

yqXDkLKCqAJooB_b_Auw5A.text: Brunchin' I was stoked to try Andre's after my favorite @unfiltereddames shared a photo of delicious beignets dusted with the right amount of powered sugar. Do your belly a favor and order them (trust me)! In addition to the exceptional service provided by our extremely knowledgeable server Jose (whose sense of humor was delightful) the restaurant itself is comfortable.   What We Ordered  Beignets $7.00 5/5 Escargot $12.00 Surprisingly, smooth texture considering the mental picture I had of eating Spongebob's best friend Gary. Moules Frites $24.00 Great flavor and the fries are a great balance Lobster Roll $18.00 5/5  Souffle $12.00 1/5 Absolutely terrible grand marnier flavored dessert.  Overpowering egg like flavors.  Bottomless Rose $22.00 5/5   $108+ tip I'll be back!

oZnImbGeQLMjZFzMbJcsUA.text: Came to Andre's yesterday after our new roommate saw a picture on Facebook of their seared Foie Gras.   We arrived at about 4pm, right in the middle of happy hour, which is daily from 3-6.   We tried:  Cheese and charchuterie board:  This was excellent.  several different cheeses, meats, tiny pickles, currants.  The cheeses ranged from mild to super funky (and all of them delicious!).  The prosciutto and the spicy pork were my favorite meats.  Seared foie gras: When this came out, we were honestly quite disappointed.  The photo we had seen on Facebook showed a large piece of Foie...what came out was a tiny scrap that liquefied when we tried to cut into it.  It was severely under cooked.  We sent it back, and shortly received a properly cooked much larger portion.   Once we got the proper cook, it was absolutely delicious.  Served over brioche with figs and a balsamic reduction with hazelnuts, this was worth the trip.    Sunday plate: Duck A L'Orange:  Duck breast served over a crispy waffle with orange sauce, fois gras, and spinach.  This was delightful.  The duck was cooked to perfection, the spinach was lovely, and the waffle was excellent: crispy on the outside, soft on the inside.    For dessert we had the creme brulee, which was the best creme brulee I have ever had.  I definitely would come back just for this.    Service was very nice and prompt.  All the servers and the hostess were courteous and personable.    I like the vibe of the restaurant.  Classy, where you absolutely could dress up for a nice meal, but still casual enough to feel comfortable in jeans.  We sat on the patio which was nice and quiet.    I would most definitely come back again for happy hour, and Andre's also offers a tea service, so we will be coming back in a few weeks to try that out.

aEpVfprNlFy74WYxKbeT8w.text: We came for a belated birthday brunch and enjoyed our time here!  We shared the lyonnaise salad and the mussels. Both were delicious but the mussels were amazing as were the fries that came with them. They also give you a baguette for the table in a cute little bag.   I'm so glad to have Andre's in the neighborhood since it is one of the few options in the area that is perfect for a date night or brunch with the girls. Pricing is reasonable and ambience is nice.  I feel like the bottomless mimosas would be more appropriate at $15 but $22 is not bad.   Service was great! Everyone was friendly and our server even brought out a birthday candle for me. I can't wait to come back for dinner and happy hour.

SPR30dvpEAeIj3rUXSsHug.text: I just want to say, I'm very disappointed.....in myself that I did not come here sooner. I cannot count how many times I've passed by this restaurant and told myself "I need to try this place." After seeing that they were participating in Restaurant Week, I finally made the effort to go!   Andre's is located in the old DW Bistro. It's a great neighborhood restaurant and honestly, for those living in the southwest, we are lucky! It was a busy night when we went (Thursday night) so I would recommend making reservations. We got seated right away which was nice. Service was great from beginning to end. I should've gotten the name of our server! I had asked him some questions regarding the menu and he was able to answer them without any hesitation, so props to him.   Onto the food!   - Wagyu beef carpaccio: loved this! It has a nice contrast with the smoked sea salt and capers.   - Seared foie gras: this was definitely melt-in-your-mouth type tx. It comes with figs (?) and basalmic reduction along with shaved parmesan.   - duck a l'orange: it was cooked perfectly. I was expecting more of a orange taste to it (bc name of entree) but the sauce that came with it is lightly seasoned with the orange taste.   - lobster thermidor: omg this was phenomenal! It came in a bowl. The bottom of it consisted of mashed potatoes, and there were asparagus and mushrooms. Big chunks of lobster too.   - creme brulee: you can tell it's made with real vanilla beans bc there's black specks in the custard. I really liked this dessert. There was a nice crunch from the sugar coating and the custard itself wasn't super sweet.   - chocolate walnut gateau: This was meh for me. But honestly it's bc I'm not a huge fan of walnuts. The dark chocolate layer on top was good though.  I will definitely be back! I really liked everything that was served.

EHQlHLKKEQH9cSfQPK_hIQ.text: Updated review for Restaurant Week 2018. I selected Andre's for the three course restaurant week dinner because the menu was a tribute to Anthony Bourdain. Appetizer - Escargot Entree - Duck a l orange Dessert - Chocolate Walnut Gateau  We had reservations and seated immediately. The dining room was nearly filled. Our server Nate was on point. He took our cocktail order right after we were seated and in a few minutes after the cocktails arrived he took our dinner order and provided a loaf of bread with butter, olive oil and balsamic. The escargots, six to an order were plump and tender in a tasty garlic herb butter sauce. The bread was perfect to sop up the sauce. Yum  The duck breast was cooked medium rare, sliced and sitting on a bed of spinach and  along side the dauphinoise potato cake with duck confit topped with orange slices. Surrounding the plate was a pool of gravy. Wow it was a rich brown delicious gravy.  The chocolate walnut gateau  was chocolate glazed caramel, walnut torte with creme anglaise. A marvelous finish.  A minor glitch during the evening was that a side order of green beans was not delivered with the entree and arrived later after our server was advised. Removal of empty plates was slow which appeared to be the need for additional support staff as the servers were working flat out.

5TJIQvU9GrdPEyQJ7HxNDA.text: Reading Yelper's friends review, I was like I must try it! Great to know a French restaurant is 10mns away from home and away from the strip. Location is great near Patrick and Fort Apache. We decided to sit at the booth. Place is nice, charming. Waiters were pleasant. From our table I had a great panoramic of the restaurant and spacious patio. The bar well loaded and has a nice seating area. It was our first time here so I called a friend to join for the happy hour 3pm to 6pm daily including weekend. We ordered - escargots de bourgogne persilles - seared Foie Gras - plateau de charcuterie - salade lyonnaise with duck leg confit (in France the salade is with warm potato) - onion soup - souffle half chocolate, half grand marnier  Escargot were ok, I added some salt to make it more tasty. I didn't taste the parsley butter at all :/ Charcuterie platter was well presented. Portion were too small. They could add some fresh grape fruits. Not sure if portion is smaller during Happy hour (saw other yelpers pics) the Pate was 1/4 of the one pictured on most pics posted :( Seared foie gras was excellent ($24) and the salade lyonnaise as well. Salad dressing was delicious. If you just want an onion soup for dinner, you might have to order 2... the portion is an appetizer portion. The Souffle was good but little disappointed. I couldn't taste the good french chocolate at all. CPK chocolate souffle is even tastier   My experience was mitige (half/half). Super happy to have a nice french close by. The staff was nice and on top of it. We booked a table at 5:30pm to enjoy the happy hour. It would be nice to make a last call on happy hours. I just noticed they did not apply the happy hours on 2 items :/ not cool!

tMMkFCqYw52PpqGOXkWzKA.text: Being a regular at Alize (which has sadly closed) I was looking forward to trying out Andre Rochat's new neighborhood French Bistro. Lovely intimate setting, pleasant ambiance.  Went with my girlfriends around 4 pm and found out they have happy hour from 3-6 pm everyday! You heard me right, everyday and in the entire restaurant, not just bar area.  Beautiful wine selection, by the glass is $2 off for happy hour. I ordered a sparkling rose which was light and crisp.   Our server was very friendly and suggested some good vegetarian and Vegan options. I love gnocchi so decided to try that. It was delicious, served in a light creamy butter sauce, tender melt in your mouth gnocchi topped with crispy thin onions. My friends tried mushroom risotto which was fantastic.  If you love souffle, their Grand mariner and chocolate souffle is an absolute must! I tried cream brulee which was excellent, the crust on top was perfect.   I can't wait to return and try the rest of the menu :)

QWJMIQ_p9ZlZy_7qibxjqw.text: I debated heavily on writing this review as I am a fan of this place and want to give it some love BUT I didn't want to let out one of my secret spots. This gem that is hidden in a strip mall on the west side of town where many people do not venture out to. They are situated at the old DW Birsto location for those of you who remember.  The food here is a great representation of French food and is beautiful! There are many awesome eats at this place: Andre's burger is one of my favorites on the menu. Such a well balanced burger and at a great price on happy hour.   Recommendations to eat here:  The lobster thermador. It is on occasion the plat du jour (special of the day). If you have never had this dish, it is highly recommended. It's a very flavorful dish. Crazy creamy sauce and lobster covered in cheese.  Prime Rib  Steak Frites: simple goodness... steak and French fries. Can't go wrong on this.  Lobster Roll. The rendition here is a slaw style one as opposed to the type you would find in New England ( just meat on a roll) that we all are accustomed to. The slaw mix with the lobster is very tasty and does not take anything away from the lobster.  French onion soup. Always solid cheesey goodness.   Another plus at this place is that they serve Fitz's Root Beer; those mid-west people know what I am talking about!  Andres is one of my favorite spots on the west side. Eat with confidence.

n5gZ02s6hoxFWTBjV5F4SQ.text: Services: 2 stars Food: 3.5 stars  Atmosphere:4 stars   I have been here quite a few times for both brunch and dinner. I enjoy some of the items a lot but I feel like they need to work on consistency here. The services here I received majority of the time also turned me off.   Services: on my recent visit, this old waiter with the accent made me not wanting to come back. He had my table before the recent visit as well. I was not a fan of him because he's not polite and borderline rude. On our entire visit, he only came to check on us once at the beginning and handed us the check. I had to get another server to take our order. And the other server was the one who came back and refilled the water. He explained to me that the older gentleman was "busy". He passed by our table several times. He never once acknowledged us. What was the worst was when he handed us the bill, he didn't say anything AT All! Not a thank you, not a sorry that I wasn't able to take care of you guys earlier. Just dead silence. He needs to be trained how to be a server. His behavior was absolutely not acceptable. I appreciate the other younger server who took care of us though.   Food: I like the food here for the most part. However, they are not consistent.   Things I have tried:   1. French Onion Soup (3/5): I loved their French onion soup the first time I've had it and I recommended it to my friends who lover this dish. However, like other yelper mentioned, where's all the cheese? For some reason, the cheese wasn't there the second time I had it and it was disappointing.   2. Lyonnaise Salad (5/5): I usually add the duck with my salad. It is delicious with the perfectly poached egg. They can also split into two for you. You can add additional egg for another person.   3. Escargot (4/5): the sauce is yummy with their baguette.   4. Seared Foie Gras (4/5): I've only had it once. It was good but not the best I've had.    5. Moules Frites (2/5): it was lacked of flavors and a boring dish.   6. Flat iron steak (2/5): I ordered medium rare and it came out medium well?! Did not enjoy my steak at all. Duck Fat fries was still good then.   7. Andres burger (5/5): the burger is really good! I suggest your share the burger and get a salad with someone else. The flavor was excellent. However, it's quite greasy to eat the whole burger if you don't have a big appetite.   8. Chicken and waffles (2/5): what happened to the whole waffle! We only got half of the waffles. The pictures from other yelper came with the whole waffles (4pc). We only got 2 pieces. Since we were not that hungry, we didn't ask the server. Even the two pieces were super tiny. I wouldn't order it again. Better flavored chicken and waffles elsewhere.   9. Duck Fat Fries (3/5): I used to love it but on my recent visits, the flavor of duck fat was not there.   10. Souffle (5/5): Love the grand mariner souffle here. One of the best in town.   11. Quiche Lorraine (4/5): I enjoyed the quiche. But the potato on the side was meh.   Their kitchen needs to be more organized too. One time I took my friend there to celebrate her engagement. We basically finished my dish before they were able to serve hers. She ended up getting it togo. In all, there's definitely recommended dishes from this place, however, if the consistency and quality of the services can't be provided. I foresee this place will have the same fate as the one in Monte Carlo and Alize.

sZ7PcGg66D5T8rMz43oiYQ.text: Where do I begin? I've never been the one to write a review immediately after trying out a place but this is a different case. The low star rating is in no regards to the quality of the food. The food was great and nicely prepared but was it timely? So, so. Were we able to place our order in a timely manner? No. Quite frankly, the food was the only positive thing about this experience but sadly it's not worth coming back for the service or lack thereof that my friends and I received.   We had set reservations for 11:15 today for brunch. My girls and I arrived in a timely manner and we were actually a few minutes early. We were seated once our time came. Mind you, they were also hosting an event/private party in the other room and it was fairly busy for a Sunday but that's expected. What is also expected is to be able to place our order within 15-20 minutes of being seated, but it took 45 minutes or so for us to just place our order. Not once did anyone come by to check on us until after someone finally took our order. The food came out about 20 minutes or so after being placed. I wouldn't have mind it if I wasn't already having hunger pains from waiting just to place my order.   I understand that they had a full house and an event next door but they should have staffed their restaurant adequately in order to serve their guests. What was even more bothersome was that two tables next to us who had been newly seated; they were able to place their order shortly after being seated and received their food before we did. I get it, shit happens. People call out, you get short staffed, whatever. My friends and I would have been more understanding for the delay if we were addressed as such; "Hey! Sorry for the delay, we're a little short staffed but what can we do for you guys until then?". Or where was the manager? The manager could've helped his staff and been like, "Hey! We're short staffed, let me take your guys order". But no, we were overlooked repeatedly.   When we finally got our food, it was good. I was expecting to get it by Christmas by the way they were moving but nonetheless, the food was good. I had the Breakfast sandwich with a side salad. You can choose between ham & bacon. It has two eggs any style, gruyere cheese, pretzel bun, & truffle mayo. The others ordered the lobster roll, the Lorraine quiche, and beignets. Everything came out great. But the overall experience, tainted the quality of the food. I have no plans to return this place. I don't have the patience nor the time. It is such a disappointment considering I've heard good things about this place and the food was good but the overall experience and service is not worth it.

x-9wh40gBwmG00lHCva49Q.text: Me and a friend of mine came here to try out Andre's dinner menu. I loved the ambiance it looked very relaxing. We started out with the bread which was fresh and so tasty. I tried not to hog the bread to myself. (We are both bread lovers) . Then I tried the Beet salad which was amazing . It had walnuts, goat cheese...seems simple but it was delicious! I also liked that they didn't used canned beets you can tell they were fresh. I was craving the Fall  Risotto ($21.00) because I haven't had Risotto in a while. This dish didn't disappoint and it was very filling. It had roasted mushrooms, sage butter and Parmesan cheese.  I tried my friend's steak and frites which was good but I was happier with my order. I ended my meal with the Chocolate Pot De Creme ($8.00) It's an oven baked chocolate custard topped with Chantilly cream and a homemade vanilla cookie. I wish this dessert came with more cookies because I liked paring it with the custard. The service was wonderful and our waiter was really nice.

qTRYj8ZQH7sfE7yIX2pWVg.text: AFTERNOON TEA - we had a 12 Noon Reservation and were seated in a room separate from the main dining room (Navy velvet area).  We were seated right away and met our server.  The table setting was nice with mismatched teacups and saucers, and nice silver table service.  I have been to other afternoon teas in Las Vegas such as Bellagio, Mandarin Oriental, Bellagio, and Lake Las Vegas.  For the price of this Tea at Andre's, it was nice ($26).  The price of the other teas are double Andre's which includes parking distance at large resorts.  Our Service was Good but at the end, it was like our server disappeared (he was assisting other diners).  Food was good but not Great.  The main tea I wanted to try, 8 Treasures, was not available.  I enjoyed my time here and despite the few hiccups, I would return.

TWlQdsWt1dnSyVr7P8V-gQ.text: I went here today with 2 friends and our children.   Service - 1 star It took almost 30 minutes before we were able to order and our food didn't arrive until over an hour after we arrived. No one stopped to see how we were doing. Even though we did ask if the kids foot could come out early, and were told it would, we got all of our food at the same time and at this point the kids were starving  Beignets - 5 stars These were delicious. Hot, sweet and amazing.  If everything else hadn't t been so horrible I would be back for these.   Kids mac and cheese - 1 star for kids, 3 stars for an adult This is not a kids mac and cheese.  It may be on the kids menu but it's not for kids.  Bread crumbs on top and made with a strong flavored cheese.  The cheese to noodle ratio was also way off with the noodles swimming in cheese and the noodles were way over cooked to mush. Neither of the kids that ordered it ate it which was lucky for me (see below).   Kids chicken fingers - 2 stars for kids, 4 for adults Also and adult dish hiding on the kids menu.  My son loved the fries. The chicken fingers had some sort of spice in the breading.  I thought they were delicious but none of the kids would eat them. Also, this plate came out scalding hot. The waiter carried it out with a napkin and warned us how hot the plate was.  When I pointed out it was for a one year old and we would like a cool plate the set it down anyway and said it wasn't that hot. When I touched it I almost burned myself.  Considering toddlers reach out and grab everything I'm lucky we didn't walk away with blisters.  Despite the temperature of the plate, the food was ice cold. Lucky for me, my some likes cold food so he still ate the fries.   Brioche French Toast - 1 star I ate one bite of the French toast which was both greasy and cold.  I'm not sure how you make French toast greasy.  The waiter asked how the food was after I had the first bite and I mentioned it was cold. He took it back and after everyone else was half done with their meals, he brought back the same plate which was now lukewarm and rubbery.  It had clearly been stuck in a microwave.    Ceaser salads - 1 star Neither person that ordered one had more than 2 bites.   My friends did get the quiche and French onion soup and said both were good.    I ended up eating cold chicken fingers and mushy noodles swimming in cheese.  No one in the restaurant seemed to notice that the vast majority of food that we ordered went uneaten. Needless to say we won't be back.

zRdPHe6kE4XN3jVpGHeaTA.text: Went for brunch and were greeted by a friendly server and hostess. We started with the escargots that went well with the fresh French bread. Ordered the steak frites which was beyond small even for a lunch portion. Waiter said it should be at least 5oz. I imagine it was no more than 4oz...4 slices of steak?! Thought the flavor was good, but I've never seen a restaurant serve anything that small, not even a filet. I had the mussels. The flavor was good but menu read "served with tomato, parsley, garlic, etc" and they came out in a saffron cream sauce. When the server insists there are tomatoes in the sauce and can't understand that's not the point - the menu doesn't mention CREAM...the description needs to be rewritten. The food tastes fine but the execution and menu need more attention.

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Child size portion of steak frites :(

TKLtq41kl4e7xaV0bNt5-Q.text: I found this spot when I was out running errands at lunch time the other day. I sat  at the bar had the best French onion soup ever and a glass bottle coke. The bartender was friendly and made me feel at home.   Followed up by the best cappuccino!   My hubby and I went again today and shared a burger for happy hour and we believe it was Andre that waited on us and he treated us like royalty even though we only spent $18.

biDNnIkLVm4PcNLu1MfKqA.text: This experience was wonderful from beginning to end. The atmosphere is cozy but a little on the high end side. Alfredo was our server and he made great suggestions and was very attentive and personable. There is a huge wine selection and he suggested the perfect Boudreaux. We had the foie gras which was the best foie gras I've ever had! It was lightly seared and melted in your mouth. The escargot was probably the best I've ever had as well. Next was the prime rib which was massive and super tender. we had a chocolate cake for dessert which was recommended as well. Will definitely be back!

QrZ4kg8r8b5BKjbXMFEFpA.text: Came with friends for a bday.  Food was amazing,  drinks even better and the owners were so sweet that they sat with us for a photo.  Our new fav spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy

3rsBkgyIWjREJyTj0gzdbg.text: Great food, cooked perfectly. Definitely worth the wait. The roasted chicken was moist and the skin was crispy to perfection. I will definitely come back to try other options.

5CqyDlGDQuIGemtOhDzFEw.text: Excellent restaurant off the strip. Its nice to have a higher quality local restaurant and not have to schlep out to the strip just for dinner. The new location is in a plain strip mall, but the restaurant itself has great curb appeal. It has the same layout of the former DW Bistro, but it has a French farm-to-table feel once you walk inside.  The blonde waitress we had (apologize that the name escapes me if she is reading this) was excellent and has been with Andre for a number of years. Always a good sign when the staff is loyal to the brand! We all ordered French onion soup and I had the mussels and frites. French Onion Soup was a tad underwhelming considering that we were at a French restaurant but the mussels and frites were divine. Mussels is my go-to order whenever I see it on a menu, and Andres' mussels reminded me of the time I lived in France- so good!  Of course we had to try the grand mariner souffle which was the best thing I had all night. Make sure you place your order with your food! It was heaven.  I checked out their brunch menu while I was there, looks excellent and can't wait to go back!

TrhDusD-4UzWg-hxUSWAuQ.text: The newest Andre's Bistro just opened and is well worth the wait! Killer Lobster Roll and great wine list! Not to mention the friendly staff and warm ambiance!

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

smuHIYp6PKRbo8bPkUYdnw.text: Delicious & perfect lunch spot!! Great quality food & service. Nice decor & vibes. The power express lunch is a great deal!!

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0HZxxKJ7kGVpv0E8vXB9ag.text: Went for brunch on Sunday. Everything we had was great. The mimosa normand was awesome. Had Charcuterie, beignets, french toast, waffles, smoked salmon benedict, and the croque madame. Service was great and the price was reasonable.  Cant wait to go back! So happy to have them as neighbors!

G1Mo63624sM8tYjlC2GJ9Q.text: We walked in on a busy Sunday morning. This place was filled with people and seemed so promising. Our server was kind and cheerful and seemed eager to serve us.    First bad part, we were sat down in the middle of two other tables when there were other tables that were open. The people to our left seemed to be planning a bridal shower and were talking loudly. I came to eat a good brunch, not listen to other people's plans.   Then, the food took some time to arrive and honestly, it looks way better than it tastes. We ordered the lobster roll, chicken and waffles, and also the chocolate souffle which added up to about $50. A friend recommended this place so we had high expectations and we felt nothing but disappointment. The lobster roll was covered in mayo, and seemed more like a lobster slaw inside a bread bun if anything. The waffles were super doughy and soft and the sauce made it even worse. The chicken wasn't crunchy what so ever. It was super mushy and I believe it was the sauces fault also. In my opinion, replacing the sauce with maple syrup on the side would have helped make it somewhat better. The souffle was just nothing special.   The sad part about it all, was that the complimentary bread and butter tasted better than the meals we had ordered.   There was also a server walking around, asking different tables if what he was carrying was their order. Sir, you should know where you are bringing your food to.   Not planning on coming here ever again and would not recommend anyone to either.

iHKWgLgWK-3ynIvyHLWmyg.text: Love so many things about this place. So so happy that Andre decided to open a Bistro in the neighborhood! Love the quotes on the windows, interior is warm and comfortable. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Now... onto the food... the punch is so so good! Steak frites, the muscles!!!! Everything is amazing! The lemon tart is my favorite...

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HLS7xwceEJ8jcFU4r36fhw.text: Great place, great food, great service.  Went for brunch.  I had classic eggs benedict, very good.  Just needed more ham.  Had the appetizer, maple glazed bacon.  Amazing.  Husband had steak and eggs, eggs were really good, but steak was really thin and kind of rubbery.  Just not very good quality.  But, that really was the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars.

6ZDbwo7rcxJOmYoYnhA2JA.text: Located in the Old DW bistro spot, much better and cleaner looking.  The service at lunch was just ok needs a little work, we went for lunch and the server didn't really know the menu. The food however was very good! everything we tried was fresh and had good flavor. Good french food off the strip! we will be back.

e4lzjzN12jNUUv9fn6f2tQ.text: What an amazing new addition to the SW! Had the feel of a neighborhood restaurant. Intimate and inviting. Dani was our server and she was knowledgeable and funny and attentive. I had the wild mushroom risotto (the only Veg option on the menu unfortunately) and it was delicious. I hope they will increase that selection on their menu at some point. The portions are large and the sides are perfect to share between two!  Looking forward to checking out their happy hour!!

L6jy4WB82kvYZcM3zgg7bQ.text: Excellent bistro. Lamb shank incredible!!  Loved the Grand Marnier Souffle.  Enjoyed the ambience and the service. Ricotta gnocchi was novel with witty green pea puree.

-BJKnQhgZL0PM4wP8zOY5A.text: The food here is to be expected.  PHENOMENAL!!!   Service was spot on perfect.  Will be back for sure.  Very refreshing to get a local restaurant that competes with the quality of strip casinos.  And at a fraction of the price.  Well done!!

St-xGzGamhUthnzEP1QROw.text: This could be my new happy place! It checks the boxes: great food, relaxed atmosphere, and I can walk to it. If you live in the Southern Terrace neighborhood, get moving to this local business!I've been there 3 times in the last 10 days. Had lunch, dinner, and brunch. All were delightful. Service has been excellent every time. Shout out to Alfredo at brunch today! Haven't had anything on the menu that wasn't delicious. Stand-out items were the steak frites (traditional bistro faire done right), the creme brulee (the shining example of what it should be), Caesar salad (classic with the right amount of garlic and anchovy), and moules frites (perfectly prepared mussels and duck fat fries). A side note on the duck fat fries: If you're a fat phobe, you're missing out. These are French fries as god intended. A leisurely stroll to a lovely bistro with great food and great service.  Next, I'm trying happy hour!  Truly transporting.  Merci, Andre!

vMLmb4KGpU9LJQeRz1fQBg.text: Came here on a date. Was super excited because I loved the original one Downtown.  While the vibe is different and the menu slightly 'less complicated', I loved it! Was happy to see they kept the street sign.  I had the calamari and beet salad. The calamari had an amazing sauce.  Then the flat iron steak with bordelaise sauce was absolutely delicious.  As we're the mussels.  I plan to come often.

ykibKd9IwmEYz3rYsf78Iw.text: This review is for 4.5 stars.   Andre's really impressed me. I had never been to the strip restaurant but when I heard this place had opened I had to try it. The sausage omelette was one of top 5 omelettes I have ever had. Ingredients inside were generously portioned and perfectly cooked. The accompanied potatoes were great with a sauteed onion extra included. Accompany that with $25 bottomless mimosas and you'll surely enjoy your meal. The best part is brunch lasts until 3:30pm so your mimosas won't go to waste even if you get a late start to your Saturday or Sunday.   The only couple of things knocking this review down from a 5 is the bread tasted a little stale/hard and the waiter disappeared for times. He was great when he came around and was very nice, but we couldn't track him down when it came time to order some extras like hot sauce or drinks.   But overall this is one of the better brunches in town and for sure the best in the southwest.

3lzv5_SEFmDPCDhkCzrH7w.text: Really wanted to like the food, but was disappointed. Got the foie gras and lamb shank. The piece of foie gras itself was really small like the size of my palm. It was seared, but tasted burnt and part of the fat of a steak with a liver aftertaste. The combo was weird also, it came with a sweet berry cream-like sauce and almond crumble. If they hadnt given me bread I probably wouldnt have finished it.   The lamb shank was better. Very large portion. I don't think they should serve it with orzo pasta, the sauce had an overpowering tomato taste. Mashed potatoes, veggies, or even couscous would be better. I hope to come here again and try their HH or something different and hopefully better.

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small piece of foie gras for $18. Dont recommend; try lamb shank or risotto instead.

eq0bgrjdzGMV7zwQdg2mQQ.text: The last place I ate Moules and frites was Cherbourg about a month ago, in. Michelin starred restaurant.  So Andres is being compared to a very high standard. PEI mussels are the gold standard in mussels - and the broth they were in at Andres was excellent.  The frites, fried in duck fat, were perfectly garnished with garlic - a delectable combination of mussels and frites as a result.  Had escargot as an appetizer - good but my preference is for stronger wine and garlic in the sauce.  Service was attentive without being obtrusive.  All in all a very pleasant dinner.  I plan to return to delve deeper into the menu - oh, the cocktails are excellent as well

-IJh92Pkwh9SotRtxIWiWg.text: Not sure where to begin, I ordered all my usual favorites . Mashed potatoes were dry and almost cold, sauteed spinach was boring , missing salt and over cooked , the goose liver was lost in a sea of balsamic vinaigrette, my wife's chicken had still feathers on it . The charcuterie was definitely not fresh! Service was good but food was the worst French food I had in this town . Bouchon at the Venetian is ten times better and as close as you can get to a French Bistro in this town.

h9k2M6tE5Fo1Gw28-oKfgw.text: Food here is very good and reasonably priced.  We brought our 2 year old and he liked it.

jMRZiNrmWfMpvG_QzrjkKg.text: A fantastic french restsurant,bread, escargot & amazing mussels in a saffron cream sauce.  The good was superb,  the wait staff we're so attentive.  Great wine selections,  Deserts.  This was such amazing food experience.

Qtxrf7ow2xoxRdqPKXYj8w.text: The food was marvelous! & the service was 5/5! My hubby brought me here for an early birthday dinner & after months of looking at the pictures on Yelp and friends confirming how good is was i knew we had to try it; we were not disappointed:) First we started with a couple of shots & shortly after we got bread & butter to enjoy until our entrees came out. I got the lobster roll w duck fat fries as my side. I was pretty impressed. Some places just shove a bunch of lobster on a soggy bun and call it a day ; however, this lobster roll had just enough lobster & the roll was perfectly grilled. Had just the right amount of seasoning. The duck fat fries omg!!!!!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Hubby got Andres Burger (which we split both the roll and burger) & we both approved! Typical burger, but loaded with flavor and really juicy. Only thing we ordered well done, but there was a good amount of pink, no complaints though we didn't say anything. He got regular fries because I don't think he liked how "duck fat" fries sounded lol but he had some of mine & he said they were amazing & he will be getting them next time! Last but not least, dessert. We got the half chocolate half grand manier (spell check) which was the only thing I was kind of disappointed in. Just not what i was expecting I guess? More mouse like than the lava cake type of flavor and experience I was expecting. We will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Roll w Duck Fat Fries
Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the outside seating
Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy bread &amp; butter

3vz4yTorbI-DkaqdShfbeA.text: Went in for their Happy Hour after spending a day hiking at Red Rock Canyon. We were a bit dusty from the hike, but the restaurant didn't seem to mind. We had the house made sausages, Andre's burger (they asked how we wanted it, so we went with rare) and the pot de creme for dessert. And plenty of drinks. Perfect way to end the day with a semi-causal romantic dinner!

_QZCOhjAb_d5ImBY4yQFQQ.text: Absolutely excellent! I went in for Happy Hour. Had the Wagyu Sirloin perfectly med. rare. Tender, slightly charred with so much flavor. Also had the Caesars salad & mashed potatoes. All mouth watering delicious! The servers were excellent, very nice, helpful & attentive. Bless them. I'm picky when it comes to steak & Andre's nails it. Not only for the steak but the entree's as well. Thank You for an outstanding meal & the dear people you have employed.

JpBt4M-ci_3j0uAP85ltoQ.text: We are visiting from California and are restaurant owners... we had the best dinner and service!!! Amazing happy hour too!!!!! Thank you Andre's for a fun and delicious dinner!!!!

7xB6S-tbbUiskVTBGFaIPg.text: What a delightful place. My wife and I came on a lazy Sunday afternoon and the service was flawless. The food is excellent.  I had the lamb burger with duck fries. It was perfect. Even the ketchup was amazing.  My wife had the beet salad and she thought it was good.  The bread is a treat and I highly recommend the indulgence before the main meal.  I highly recommend Andre's, you won't regret it!

86Ue2nZaqKmrA_MsKJoOrg.text: For my first meal of 2018, I came here. I didn't know anything about it other than it had frog legs on the menu, and I wanted them. It's in a good location not far from 215. I got there around 4:30PM so it wasn't too busy, yet, but happy hour is between 3-6PM. I sat at the bar and the bartender was friendly and almost too accommodating, but without being pushy. This was appreciative. It almost felt like he was being a good host at his house, rather than an employee behind the bar.  Aside from the frog legs, I saw they also had escargot (which I also like) but I opted for the cheese and charcuterie board instead. The frog legs didn't take long at all. They were good but maybe just a tad bland, though that's less of the frog and more of the batter surrounding it. I would have like a little more flavor, personally. The cheese and meat board was excellent. There was a nice variety of meat, cheese, pate, fruit, and olives. On top of that, combining different things yielded so many different flavors. Highly recommended.  While it isn't necessarily close to my house, I'm definitely going to come back, especially for happy hour. Prices on most of the menu are reduced, including beer and wine.

9bucD--n8SAGtsGNvrop-w.text: Great place close to home. Came for the mussels and fries, not disappointed at all!! The mussels were well cooked and fresh, the duck fat fries......need i say more? Excellent service, tasty French 75, i look forward to trying more.

CkVzQHqsWQHDCjG-CwI4fg.text: Enjoyed a lovely Saturday brunch!   Hubby and I popped in on a Saturday at 11:30 and it was pretty quiet. There were only about 3-4 tables. I had a scrumptious Bloody Mary and he had a sazerac.   We shared the mussels with duck fat fries and the lobster roll with green salad as we were in the mood for savory lunch vs. the sweets. There were lots of options on the menu. These two dishes were excellent! Fries were divine. Mussels were tender and flavorful and huge. I honestly didn't love having to bite into them but it's not their fault they got giant mussels. The lobster roll was generous for the price and tasted fresh and scrumptious on the buttery roll.   We were stuffed so we didn't make it to a souffle or beignets despite our interest. Our bill was $62 which I thought was very reasonable for cocktails and nice seafood. Additionally, they had a Groupon at the time so it really was a steal!  Ambiance is nice and service was excellent.   We would certainly return for another meal service or brunch again.

irS_SclFAzGWMqIpBHuHpA.text: It is a charming little restaurant with great food and good waiters.  I love the music and decor. I have been here twice and each time everything was delicious.

je_z-_ftfrYp4_A_8KmkCQ.text: Totally inconsistant. Same dish cooked and presented differently each time. Same thing for the taste. Definitely not justifying their high prices. Recommend = no. Will go back = no.

AL7OHiiA6kXyCRK1YsXXSA.text: Food is amazing and happy hour definitely makes me happy. The service is always fast and friendly. They make sure you're done with a meal before presenting the next so your table is never overwhelming. The decor is perfect for anytime of the day. The prices are a little high but a great place to experience

aMV6obqt9caLihIXKlqvdw.text: Our family reserved the private dining area this past Sunday to celebrate my daughters 1st birthday. The room was decorated so beautifully. For 50 it was cozy which was perfect for us. We have been there several times for brunch so we knew the food would be delicious. Which of course it was. Many compliments on the lobster roll and salmon. The most amazing experience of the night was the service that was provided. Jana who coordinated everything for us was so thorough and kind. Once we got there, Lori was the coordinator who assisted us. She went above and beyond to accommodate our every request and every need. We couldn't thank her enough to making this celebration a memorable night. Additionally the pastry chef designed a beautiful 3-tier cake for us. We can't stop looking at the pictures. The entire night was a celebration that exceeded our expectations. Thank you!

Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G3upkCpF7KJY0QTN8xUssA.text: I am in town for work and am tired and didn't feel like going out.  I was pleasantly surprised to find something other than Chinese or Pizza to order for delivery, especially since I love French food!!! I ordered the Lobster Roll with duck fat fries and the French onion soup ( which I was certain would be a terrible take out item) and it was ALL FABULOUS!!! I'm in town tomorrow night as well and am already craving the soup and looking forward to a frisee salad and seared Foie Gras!

2tlnbkPl_PL9ZB6ZUGZbAw.text: I have had two meals here and on both occasions encountered some critical missteps....bland mussels, soggy frizze, underdone poached egg, duck confit tasted like it had been reheated, charcuterie did not include any cured meats...just sausage and terrine with the cheeses.  Drinks are good...ambiance is nice...they just need to get that kitchen on point.  Ok I got food poisoning the next day...had to be the duck...it tasted old and was lukewarm.

WgmCS_efc5ol-qOekIlmig.text: This place was really cute and cozy and as good as the food looked I thought it can use a bit more flavor. We have ordered from here once and ate in the restaurant once and both times I was not crazy about my food but it was very fresh and who doesn't love fresh food.

2YRUCGSI2MypVOrPup7sLw.text: Deal with drive to the strip---Nope Deal with parking and walking 1/2 mile--Nope  Andres has it going on..and then some! Great execution for "Simple Food" makes a great experience. French Onion Soup- great flavor, consistent cuts on the onion, cooks consistently....again...great execution and attention to detail.  Frissee Salad- transported me back to the small Bouchons in France...thank you bringing such amazing food memories  Escargot Provencal- great combination  of garlic, butter and fresh herbs....how can you go wrong?!?!  Thank you so much for opening this amazing restaurant....if great chefs continue  this trend of leaving the strip and opening great eateries  like this in the suburbs ...who knows...Las Vegas might actually create "Culinary Soul"

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot
Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Onion Soup

XFnroxDqJZtt8QtQCqCH5g.text: MGM's loss is our gain. The valley will now get to experience the total culinary experience that is Andres.  Andre's Bistro is an amazing space with a great vibe. The food and service are out of this world.

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1eyUh0MPz4V8FbLbvv6QTw.text: Came here one night for dinner with a group of friends because of friends just bought a new home near by and the ratings on yelp were great. This place used to be DW bistro so when we went inside and looked around it still looked similar but the dinner settings were very dim. There were candles lit on our table and we used them to look at the menu. The service was okay not super amazing. Everything we wanted off the menu our server said was not available so I stuck with the chicken which was mediocre to say the least. I was pretty disappointed a lot of the foods that were posted on yelp that we wanted were unavailable and the server kept telling us that unfortunately since they opened not too long before we came they've revamped the menu a bit so some foods they will no longer serve. Our table ordered the moules frites which was a pretty hefty portion and okay. Also, Escargot was something everyone tried at the table. That was good. I'd like to maybe give this place another try during happy hour or lunch to see if things may be different.

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xNEArk9cM_AmuHNwWE6mrQ.text: I feel very fortunate to have a restaurant with food this good so close to home. The service standards and hospitality layered in on top make this a real blessing. Oysters were fresh and ice cold, escargots were piping hot any garlicky ( I suggest some fries for the extra butter ), the foie gras sear was a perfect mahogany with just the perfect balance is sweet and savory. For entrees I loved the house-made sausages or the trout amandine but the roasted chicken was also great. If you do nothing else though you have to try the walnut gateaux & apple tarte tatin.

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zrmuENYYm3t4dkHGQIpUXA.text: Great restaurant off the beaten path in LV. Chilled tomato bisque with paquillo peppers was delicious, as was the Caesar salad. For entrees, both of us had coq au vin, which was excellent. The lemon tart for dessert was outrageously good -- tart lemon zest with a sugar cookie crust. Nice wine list. Good service from Javier. It took a bit of time to get the check at the end, however.

sx9FaVx05V5wdhtC53ghmw.text: Great breakfast today at Andre's. I had the chicken and waffles. Chicken was cooked to perfection, the waffles could have been just a bit more crispy. I will be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j824R2Fdz0p6aMX2CNdClA.text: My friend decided to have her birthday brunch here over the weekend. And we were all very satisfied.   This place has a lot of options. Which is great. But, I had to look at the pics to decide on what to get. What is good:  Lobster Roll French Toast Beignets   Do note: This place is a little pricier. Their bottomless mimosas are $24. That's pretty pricey for the other brunch places. And they really don't put a ton of champagne in it. That was probably my only complaint.   Other than that, the service was good and they were pretty quick.   Yummy place, and will definitely be back!

RAZX-H_7hq4pN0jlwY079A.text: This is my favorite place to hold a private event! Thank you, Joe, you are wonderful to work with and I appreciate all you do! They have a beautiful private room that is amplified by their wonderful menu. The food quality is on point and they offer such a unique menu compared to most of the options out there when looking for private space. I've been a semi-regular for dinner and happy hour and have loved everything from the Bouillabaisse to the burger. Tonight was the classic Dover sole, fois gras, bananas foster and of course the French onion soup! They are very accommodating with food allergies (my 5 y.o. son is anaphylactic to dairy) for which I am very appreciative. Not to mention you can order a real souffle!

ClIIPk4Cn1HL4MJVagV9lg.text: You walk up to the outside filled with quotes. Loved it! Then the inside is simple & beautiful. Service was awesome. We had the veggie terraine & a steak delicious! I have tried any dessert but the looked amazing. We also tried the salmon yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Andre's Bistro & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DOxquGDZkFKx7QFHyLl-0g.text: We had an amazing meal! The specialty cocktails were terrific. The service was friendly and informative as well. We were there early so we enjoyed the happy hour pricing. Lamb burger, mussels, chicken, duck fat fries, lobster mac n cheese. We will be bringing more friends!

a4j2xfKhGnTdE8tmdGix9Q.text: Very tasty dinner.   We used to go to the original location Downtown, and have missed its vintage charm.   This new location is cozy albeit in a strip mall, but the food is still a excellent quality.  I had the fois gras app and the lobster thermador, delish!   Service was excellent, a more casual version of the original, which is just fine for a Friday night.

50YgpDpz300k7hKOq3V03g.text: Well, where do I even begin!!! And I wish was saying that because my experience was great, but it was FAR from great. It was actually ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE.   My sister made our Mother's Day reservation via OpenTable for 6pm. We arrived a few minutes before our reservation and we were seated WITHOUT any menus. Waited about 10 mins before a waiter came with the menus. Not sure if our waiter even introduced himself.  We ordered some appetizers while we waited for the rest of our party. When they brought us our waters they mentioned that they would bring us bread. Mind you that we had already been sitting there for quite some time.  Appetizers came still no bread and butter and two glasses on the table didn't have any water. We had to ask for bread  since they never brought it in the first place. We finished our appetizers and still no bread so we asked for it once AGAIN.  We began ordering our main courses and to our surprise there were a few items that were no longer available. (At most other restaurants, when items are not available waiters let guests know beforehand, like when they are seated, so that the guests can find other options.)  Ok, so we've placed our orders and the bread FINALLY got to the table. They couldn't even get that right! We were an 8 top and they serve one half of the loaf (serves about 5 people)! Are you kidding me! We had to ask for more bread!  The first of the main entrees finally get to the table- they served the kid's chicken fingers and fries and the rest of the table had to wait about another 5-10 minutes before for their food. Of course the orders were messed up. Cobb Salad, which you would assume is a lot easier to make than steaks, arrived LAST! I personally ordered the Flat Iron Steak with bearnaise sauce, cooked medium, and a side of mashed potatoes. BUT I got a WELL DONE steak mashed potatoes and NO sauce. Also, typically when you order steaks, the waiter brings steak knives but just ANOTHER thing we as the diners had to ask for! Oh the reason for my steak being OVERCOOKED?!? Apparently it was sitting under the heat lamp too long! ARE YOU SERIOUS?!?! WHAT KIND OF HEAT LAMPS ARE THEY USING!!!! They said they were going to re-cook the steak but at this point I was so anger that this was the experience that I lost my appetite completely.  They served the filet steak medium rare when it was asked to be cooked medium with a side of mushrooms- of course they didn't get the side right for that either! Instead of mushrooms they brought mashed potatoes! WHAT ELSE CAN GO WRONG!!!!!  FINALLY, I go find the manager to let him know what's going on. He was going to fix the problem by offering free desserts but at that point we all just really wanted to leave!  We were seated next to a family who had to be friends or family of one of the waiters so of course they were attended to without any problems. . THE BEST of all the excuses!!!! Our waiter told us that they had been there all day and that were short staffed- what an excuse for the WORSE SERVICE I HAVE EXPERIENCED! (Mind you my family and I eat out at plenty of different restaurants all over the city and this by FAR IS THE WORST!)  I would normally say I would give Andre's Bistro another try, but after everything that happened I AM ABSOLUTELY TURNED OFF.   I have NEVER EVER jrefused my food be remade. I normally let them fix the mistake BUT this was not going to fix anything. Between the wait time, having to ask our waiter for everything, and messing up on orders. I was over this place!!!!!   SUCH A SHAME!   I hope that they figure their issues out and I hope that their waiters come up with better excuses!

kEqw3etykrLe-DJX4Tgb5w.text: Consistently good food and drinks.  In the summer we like the outside patio seating.  We love brunch or dinner here.  Brunch chicken and waffles yum yum, coq a van, bouillabaisse, chicken pot pie, man so many great options!   Any of the burgers we've tried are great affordable filling options as well.

piiXz2uiLOa2igWmwvmkcw.text: A hidden gem in regular little strip mall, this place is a must. It's mine and my boyfriends go to date night spot. I keep wanted to try more things on the menu but the steak is just so good! The beef carpaccio is a perfect light start. And the bread they bring to start is perfectly toasted. Service is always excellent.

ygnXe6TSYua96njJKB4xtA.text: Wow! It's been a long time since I've been this impressed by a restaurant! I don't give 5 stars often, but Chef Andre and his team deserve it.  We have been wanting to check Andre's out since it opened, and finally went  yesterday for Restaurant Week, which supports Three Square. The Restaurant Week menu was a tribute to Anthony Bourdain, who we really love and miss. Wife had the French Onion soup and the Duck a l'Orange while I went with the  Beef Carpaccio and Steak Frites. We both had the Creme Brulee for dessert. The soup was so deliciously cheesy! You could not pull the spoon out without strands of cheese following. The carpaccio was also very good, with the highlight being the parmesan and smoked sea salt. MY wife had never tried Duck a l'Orange before, and the one time I had it was disappointing. This was absolutely amazing!!! The flavor and tenderness of the duck was perfect. Almost melted in your mouth. She also loved the potatoes with the duck confit.  The flat iron steak was very tender and surprising thick, even though it was just a bit past my requested medium rare, and even better when dipped in the bearnaise sauce. The duck fat fries were to die for! Hands down the best fries I've ever had. Then again, I've never had duck fat fries before.  I'm not big on sweets, but I actually finished the Creme Brulee! Perfect balance of sweet and savory for me (yes, I watch way too much Food Network!). My wife said it was the best she'd ever had. So glad we finally went, and we look forward to going again.

5Scr_CiGgFg4cOsfhXH8jw.text: I just love this restaurant! Love the setting, the service, the food, the chic-frenchy mood and the general vibe when you walk in. The only thing I don't like is that they close too early and I'm a night owl and like to take my time to enjoy my wine

xrFzCSYWa6Qe9o4DKyIAhA.text: Highest kudos for the Afternoon Tea to Andre's and our waitstaff.  I booked a dozen ladies -- our first time -- in from my book club and we had the best time.  Service was excellent and the tea and food flowed very timely.  It was all delicious and ample portions.  We will definitely be back again sometime.

LZxUVrhTIN52PTtr9CNy6A.text: Lobster roll was really good. Great little french bistro, will definitely frequent this place

j_9oGxtCce8kdst2Cg-yHg.text: Andre's has recently become my family's favorite neighborhood spot. It seems like we have brunch there at least twice a month. The food is always tasty and service on point. I took my mom their while she was visiting and she fell in love to. It was the only place she wanted to eat at while in town!

REP6jnOMOckOQE3kjheM_Q.text: 2 things.. the food was amazing and the service and staff were not. It was really stuffy and unappreciated. However, the lamb burger and the lobster roll = WOW! Probably won't be returning for this wannabe 5 star restaurant.

gSZ8eD3zEEm-ixLsu2liYw.text: Tried it today for lunch and had a wonderful meal! Shared the Thai chicken burger which was deliciously juicy with the right amount of spice. It comes with crisp matchstick fries.  Enjoyed the Cobb salad, too.  Cobb salads can get a little run of the mill, but this had the best quality ingredients all around. Nicely presented and accompanied with the perfect vinaigrette on the side. The lunch menu has the right amount of choices; they also have a great wine list.  It seems that there's a lot of care and attention in the kitchen.  Delighted to have Andre go suburban!  Look forward to trying for dinner!

svdmrnZPpJvjp7EDOuME8Q.text: This might be the best restaurant off the strip.  Try the foie gras and the lamb shank, sooo good.

Z1pKDkFBOzdIo44LjJvAmQ.text: Food was to die for along with the impeccable hospitality.  Hats off!

HBDmHq9G7OQQpsmnGMVnxw.text: I had the calamari, the filet (grass fed), duck fat fries, and I'm about to house the chocolate souffle.  I couldn't wait to post.  This place is around the corner from my house and I'm going to be a regular!!   Cheers to this amazing mom and pop spectacular!!

FXOoZNV5UW-5JPKNQxQCug.text: Andre's Bistro & Bar is a winner!  Count me in as a regular and I have only been there once.  Everything about this restaurant is excellent, from the greeting by Patrick and John  (they are genuinely happy you are there), to the ambience, to the service, and last but not least to  the incredibly delicious and exquisitely prepared food.  We dined there last night which was the first day!  You would never have guessed that because everything was seamless.   The mood is casual with soft lighting.  You can dress up or be casual, it is comfortable either way.  Service is top notch.  Our server, Mike, really knew the menu and made outstanding wine pairings.  The evening started with perfect crunchy French bread and sweet butter.  After that, we enjoyed a Caesar salad that was the real thing...beautiful Romaine leaves, homemade croutons, and dressing with anchovies.  The next course was a stunning preparation of foie gras with thinly sliced cooked apples and a vanilla sauce, which paired beautifully with my champagne.  Our entrees were the salmon with lentils and the hangar steak with green peppercorn sauce and Duck fat fries.  Everything was flavorful and perfectly prepared.  We finished with the lemon tart, something that I have been dreaming of since the days of Andre's on 6th Street.  My dream came True...just as delicious as I remembered.   Andre's is, quite simply, Fabulous!

uhV2wIXtGxDm6t11oddi5A.text: Michael was wonderful! This place is great! We sat on the patio and it was so nice and relaxing! I would highly recommend the trout,  it was so delicious! I am definitely coming back!

9jHU5bXscnqKSkdStAxkJw.text: This is exactly what the local restaurant community needed! This place has a beautiful and up beat atmosphere! The menu can please anyone. The daily cheese selections an appetizer was the best first choice to go along with a nice glass of wine. Great wine selection too! I would highly recommend the trout, absolutely delicious! And you definitely cannot leave with having the Souffle for dessert! Everyone in our party enjoy there dinners! We will all be back! And most importantly we loved our waiter Mike!

kB8-LtKS1ZO5t0qBubieGw.text: We went to the restaurant for Restaurant Week.   We were the first customers seated for lunch at 11:30 am.  It took us until 1 pm for dessert to be served, 2 courses eaten.  This had nothing to do with us.  I understand when a kitchen can be unorganized and run behind.  We ordered the Souffle for dessert when our order as taken at 11:40, at 1pm they said that the souffle would take 15 minutes to make and successfully talked us out of the $12 dessert.  We ordered something that we could take with us since we had spent so much time in the restaurant.  We ordered off the menu, an $8 piece of cake each, and they charged us for it because it was not on the Restaurant Week menu (that they had the inability to produce within a 95 minute timeline)  They gave us 20% off, but the dessert was added at $16 and the discount was $11.20)  The food was good, but servicewise I will not go back.

FdsKRs9ok__d0lahAhlQhQ.text: This place was great service is great he name was nick . The salad was great we had the lobster roll for lunch very price is fair . We recommend it

1YuDiEOhO41GFE888zyG6A.text: Love Andre's plus I live near by, I miss the MC location as I work at Aria. Alize is also so good!

hFJ5aJ3_bAGiBxnYuI8iWQ.text: I was at the bar today around 4:15 pm i had ordered escargot and a lamb burger medium,i got the escargot after chewing on the second one i found cjopped shells in one of my escargot,let the bartender who was nice enough to take it back and apologized and got me a new order.i finished my new order and started dipping my bread in the garlic sauce that was left then i found a piece of plastic,i got really disappointed and mad.at tgat time my burger has arrived and i let my bartender know.remember i gave this kithen a second chance to correct the order especially that am a server as well so i am aware of things.i didnt finish my burger cause it was a little rare for me and plus i was disgusted with what hapoened throughout the meal.the bartender was nice and fruendly and of course he took the escargot of my check.i was craving that place for a long time but i dont think i got the best first impression.too bad cause the menu looks decent.

M-HzHI0apSuF2tv9D1reSQ.text: This place is amazing. It you haven't tried it, you're losing out. The souffle was perfect.

euySK2FMif-qFRljHy0mWw.text: Happy hour is the best deal going. The burger is great and the french fries are as well.

eG1c2Sfrz82pzSKnPYYZYg.text: I had a fantastic "power lunch" consisting of French onion soup, ricotta gnocchi and to finish it all, a malted chocolate milkshake. It was simple yet sophisticated. Plated beautifully and great service and conversation. I would highly recommend Andre's for a great lunch or dinner spot.

clapvxHC_o2z-UPLM12kpA.text: I went out to this neighborhood place on a recommendation and was expecting a great meal - thinking I probably should have hit anyplace on the strip and just overpaid or hit the In N Out.  I was there on a Thursday night and it wasn't particularly busy, but the servers seemed ill-prepared and overwhelmed (reminded me of monkeys running around the cage at the zoo).  I was never really sure who my server was as my order was taken by the hostess (who seemed to be the one bright spot on the staff).  I ordered a ribeye and spinach and a glass of wine.  When my steak came it was not even warm (I ordered it Med rare) so I sent it back.  It came back to me in about 5 minutes and it really wasn't any warmer so they offered to make me a new one and the chef was bringing it out himself.  This one was warm, but it was the oddest looking ribeye that I have ever seen - it had a really odd shape and looked like someone took a bite out of the center.  However, the steak had very little, if any, seasoning and was the toughest ribeye I have ever had - tougher than a strip steak and it really didn't taste very good.  Maybe order the next grade up of steak from Sysco or at the local grocery store where this meat must have come from (sarcasm).  I should mention that the spinach was good - very simple, but good.  They did end up comping my steak (charging me just for the wine), but I would have rather had a good steak.  I was a bit surprised that I never heard from or saw a manager and I did send them an email when I got back home detailing my experience and never heard back.   One of the most disappointing meals and overall experiences that I have had at a restaurant in quite a while.

hwtFyfYRSNWG38OojF2hCw.text: What a wonderful neighborhood experience bringing the strip to the locals of southwest Las Vegas.  Truly happy with this cozy little gem in my neighborhood with a fun French fare.  The room is warm and comfortable, beautiful wine list, delicious food, and extremely knowledgeable waitstaff.  Ask for Mike W. as he is kind, attentive, and well educated in food and wine!  We had a romantic date pairing wines with our 3 course meal all delivered in a timely fashion allowing us to talk and relax.  The chilled seafood platter was divine, steaks tender, and the chocolate dessert decadent!  We will be back!

5hGgPnJzCiuODlaqwNu7pQ.text: Nick gave us great service, very knowledgeable and friendly. The souffle wa fabulous. The lamb burger and Andre's burger were so, so good.  Happy hour has a great menu and wine list. Overall a wonderful find for us!!
